story:
Short Summary

 

  • We are Comic-Con, Film and Comic industry pros with over 30 years experience.
  • We are two best friends who started an online talk and analysis show in January of 2019, just doing what we love, "Talkin' nerdy nerd, nerd stuff."
  • Pop Culture Minefield is one of the fastest-growing YouTube shows in the Missouri Region.
  • We need to grow, and if you help us, it will help us in doing more celebrity interviews and more entertainment industry scoops as well as analysis of other news and rumors..

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • You could be credited as an actual producer of our show for one year by selecting the Producer 1 or Producer 2 level contribution. 
  • In order to push our how to the next level of professionalism we need, we need to upgrade some of our equipment for recording and editing our show.
  • Every single contributor to this campaign automatically gets a "Thank You" and listed on our YouTube channel "About Us" page as well as on our end credits as contributors to the show! Your position in the credits is based on the level of your contribution.
  • All contributions we will go directly to buying equipment for the show and helping make sure we can keep making the show happen.
  • Contributors of $65 to $99 get the Still Schwifty T-Shirt!
  • If you select the Producer Tier Contribution ($100 to $200), you will get both a Special PersonalizedStill Schwifty T-Shirt as well as an Artist Signed Official Bruce Campbell Running Time movie poster.

The Impact

We built this show with just what he had. As we have grown we started doing interviews and have been involved with a few major Film and TV scoops. And that growth has put more of an importance on looking as professional as we were personally. So, we need newer equipment :

  • Being part of Mikey Sutton's Geekosity Network, viewers get access to big film and TV scoops.
  • Our scoops through Geekosity are reliable and have been picked up by major media outlets.
  • We take pride in our show and the information we relay. Doing this show is our greatest passion.

Risks & Challenges

Thankfully there are no risks for backers, as Pop Culture Minefield will continue making shows whether this campaign is successful or not, just without new equipment.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our show and this campaign. Our show has grown thanks to a grassroots effort by people talking about us and coming over to see us. Sharing our show and campaign is a great way to help:

  • So, please help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • You can follow us and share our posts on Facebook, but you can also use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you ALL!

Watch Our Latest Episodes!
Two Recent Scoops

Our Interview with The Outpost Director, Rod Lurie

 

Keith in his PCM Tee-Shirt.

story:
Short Summary

Simply stated, VidFest expo is an extension of Podfest Multimedia Expo, one of the longest running and tightest-knit communities of podcasters and new media specialists in the world!

VidFest continues the commitment to quality content and camaraderie Podfest has become famous for over the years by providing a supportive community for video creators!

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

In just a few short years, VidFest has experienced exponential growth both in terms of its attendance and its offerings.

VidFest is built on two foundational principles: offering world-class content and programming, and fostering unparalleled camaraderie. Our community is so much more than a collection of like-minded individuals – we are family!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Join our Facebook Group
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
About A Life Less Ordinary

A Life Less Ordinary, created by media entrepreneur Udhara de Silva and former BBC executive Tanya Warnakulasuriya, is the podcast interview series that features extraordinary individuals from Asian countries. These individuals range from artists to athletes, politicians to policymakers, musicians to mavericks. We look at the little steps and the 'ordinary' things they do to become extraordinary. Each season is centred around a country, enabling listeners to gather an understanding of how a country came to be, where it currently stands, and what lies ahead for its society and culture.

This season, Udhara will be taking listeners to Singapore and collaborating with musician and radio host Vanessa Fernandez, whose local influence, connections, and on-air charisma will make for a fantastic pairing of hosts over the 12 audio episodes and 12 videos planned for the season.

The Season will air from September to November 2018 and features prominent actors, politicians, artists, athletes, and entrepreneurs in Singapore.

A Life Less Ordinary Season 1 (Sri Lanka) was rated 5-Stars on Apple Podcasts and iTunes by listeners around the world:

"What I learned from Jayanthi is that women can do anything if you are positive to take any challenge. We need more role models like her. I hope I can get more hidden inspiring stories like this with upcoming episodes" – Rukshani (Episode 1)

"I clicked play and then didn’t want to stop listening to this podcast! Two beautiful stories filled with emotion, courage, inspiration and entertainment…it just gets you listening, then thinking! "– Thejani (Episode 1)

"Very insightful podcast! The interviewers let the interviews “breathe” giving their subjects the kind of comfortable environment that draws out spontaneous and personal detail, which is often as moving and relatable as it is informative. I don’t listen to podcasts much but this one has me hooked! I hope there’s more to come" - Peter

"Just as promised, the podcast highlights the little steps, the ordinary things people do to become extraordinary" – Levi

Your support of A Life Less Ordinary will help Udhara and video director Adam Moorhead fly to Singapore for three weeks in May to produce the show with Vanessa, and come back with the audio and video footage required to create an insightful, inspiring, and entertaining show. We would also be able to distribute and promote the show to even more listeners around the world, enabling us to create future seasons in different cities in the Asia Pacific region.

What We Need & What You'll Get

We need funding for our production trip to Singapore (May 18 to June 6, 2018), video production, editing, equipment, and marketing. 

Production trip to Singapore
Sydney to Singapore return flights and insurances for Udhara & Adam: USD1600
18 days accommodation: USD2200
Meals, cabs, and other production expenses for 2 producers: USD1400
Equipment (audio equipment and video mic rental): USD500

Editing
Video production: USD1000
Episode editing: USD1100

Marketing
Digital media budget: USD1600

Additional Costs
Contingency: USD600
Crowdfunding fees: USD1500

Total USD11,500

 

We will be posting a lot of content in the lead-up to the season premier to keep you informed on the creation of the show including:

  1. Behind the scenes video and photo content on the show and host's social media channels
  2. A making-of documentary to see what goes into the making of a project as 'simple' as a podcast
  3. Promotional videos shot in Singapore
  4. Regular production updates on Udhara's social media channels, the show's website and the show's Facebook group.

 

​When the show comes out, we will be putting out:

  1. 12 fascinating audio interviews on Apple Podcasts, YouTube, and the show website.
  2. 12 short and sweet video interviews to complement the audio interviews.
  3. Additional content on each episode on the show website, including blog posts for each episode similar to Season 1.
  4. Social media content with sound-bites, quotes, and behind-the-scenes moments

 

If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds will be prioritised this way:

  1. The most expensive part of the show is flying up to Singapore and producing it (we believe the rapport and insights you can get from face-to-face interviews is unparalleled), so funds will first go to our intense 2.5-week production trip
  2. The next most important part of the project is to promote and market it. Additional funds will go to digital advertising and marketing so we can get the show heard by as many people as possible.
  3. Finally, we will put remaining funds to the editing, which we do in-house. 

 


We believe that there are so many amazing and important stories all over Asia that are dying to be heard, but just don't get the airtime or production quality their equivalents in North America or Europe get.

For many Asians, role models in business, tech, politics, art, fashion, literature and music come from the West. That's great, but we know without a doubt that the reason why there aren't as may role models within Asia is not because they don't exist, but because their stories aren't being shared enough! A Life Less Ordinary intends to change that. And from Season 1 in Sri Lanka, we saw that people are thirsty for these stories. We see an ongoing, successful future for the show, and want your support helping it grow legs and build momentum.

For Singaporean listeners tuning in to Season 2, we aim to feature both well known and lesser-known individuals in fresh ways, renewing pride in local talent and sparking curiosity to find out more about them. For listeners everywhere else, we aspire to create a portrait of Singapore that may challenge preconceptions and compel them to find out more about the guests and the country.

Ultimately, the episodes inspire ordinary people to do extraordinary things with their lives, whether that means pursuing an artistic or entrepreneurial dream, going on a once-in-a-lifetime adventure, or changing career for something more aligned to their values.

 

Risks & Challenges

There are a few obstacles we could face along the way, but we have plans to overcome each one!

Last minute guest cancellations
This is a realistic possibility for any small interview series, but we have managed to secure the commitment of several guests and have designed our busy production schedule in a way that enables flexibility, so we can easily reschedule interviews if we have to.

Unusable interview material
In the rare event of particularly coming out of an interview session with unusable material, we would either shorten the episode to get as much of the interesting parts of the conversations in your hands, or in the worst case scenario, find a replacement guest and rerecord the interview. In most cases though, intense research, preparation and guest prep would help us avoid this situation.

 

 

You might not be able to donate to our campaign, but you can still help make Season 2 of A Life Less Ordinary our best yet!

  • Subscribe to the podcast on Apple Podcasts or iTunes and catchup on Season 1 episodes. If you like what you hear, tell your friends and family to do the same!
  • Share details on this campaign on social media by using Indiegogo's share tools.
  • Tune in to Season 2 in September and leave a review on Apple Podcasts or iTunes.
  • Join the show's community of listeners on Facebook.

Thank you so much for supporting us, we cannot wait to give you the second season of A Life Less Ordinary later this year!

story:
Who We Are

We are two men with a firm faith who live with bipolar disorder (bios below). We first met when I (Tony) was launching my book, Delight in Disorder.  We had both fallen on hard times and agreed to meet weekly for prayer and walks, tears and laughter. Out of these gatherings, a mission was conceived. We developed a faith-based, peer-led mental health support group. "Faithful Friends" is still growing strong after three years, without skipping a beat (or a week).

Now, we sense a new mission emerging...

What We Will Do

Many people with mental illness feel alienated from faith communities. Many faith communities fail to understand the value of mental health care. We have lived in both worlds and found both to promote healing. Prayer and pills. Worship and therapy. Bible study and support groups. Revealing Voices (the podcast and website) will build a community where people  listen to and dialogue with others who have been impacted by mental illness and struggle with faith. We don't pretend to have the answer, but we will raise your questions and share your prayers. 

Risks & Challenges

As important as it is to share our struggles with mental health, prevailing stigma discourages us from doing so. People both within and beyond faith communities often see it as an excuse rather than an explanation; a lack of faith, not a chemical reaction; a crime, not an illness.

Eric and I are uniquely positioned to tackle this stigma head-on. We have both revealed our diagnoses to friends, family, co-workers, and the community at large. At times our method of doing this has lacked good judgement, but we have learned even from these trials. We understand the need for wise discretion for when and how you talk about mental health issues. 

What We Need

We need your financial support for the equipment needed to produce a quality podcast, including:

* MacBook Pro

* (2) Shure SM-58 microphones

* Cables, stands, accessories

* (2) Headsets

* Equipment for broadcasting phone calls

* Marketing to make a greater impact in a broader area.

* A portion of donations exceeding our goal will go to NAMI-Faith Net.

The difference you can make.

Studies show that at least 20% of the US population struggles with a mental health issue. Research also suggests that very few pastors and churches are equipped to address the needs of persons with mental illness. Your contribution will foster dialogue that offers hope for people who have troubled minds. Hope.  Compassion. With your gifts, you can invest in this vital mission.

If you are not in a position to make a financial gift at this time, we get it. There are other valued ways you can support our mission:

* Pray. Prayer is not a magical panacea to manipulate giving. Yet, through prayer, needs are met.

* Share. Tell others about our project. We'd be delighted if you'd put it on your social media.

The benefits you receive

We want to express our gratitude for your support, so we are offering a wide variety of bonuses, from a "Making of Revealing Voices" audio recording to signed copies of Delight in Disorder and Watershed. Up to an opportunity to dialogue with us on the show.

The path ahead

In her New York Times best-selling memoir An Unquiet Mind: A Memoir of Moods and Madness, Dr. Kay Redfield Jamison, writes this:

“I am tired of hiding, tired of misspent and knotted energies, tired of the hypocrisy, and tired of acting as though I have something to hide.” 

We grow tired of not being transparent. We want to share our stories.

Together, let's reveal our voices. Raise unanswered questions. Share unanswered prayers.

 

More about Eric & Tony:

Eric was born in Detroit, MI, grew up in Owensboro, KY, and moved to Columbus, IN in 1996.  Eric received a Hoosier education with a BA in History and MBA in Social Entrepreneurship from Indiana University. Currently, he works as a full-time product developer while supporting non-profits through his organization, Watershed Philanthropy. 


His life took an unexpected turn in 2008 when a devastating flood led him to become a volunteer case manager. After the experience, he wrote a book called Watershed: Service in the Wake of Disaster. 

The lessons in recovery that he learned during that time continue to inspire him today.  To honor the 10 year flood anniversary, Eric is currently working to create a park in a residential area devastated by the flood.

In 2017, Eric accomplished 2 milestone goals.  First, he hiked a marathon distance in one day in Hoosier National Forest.  He also completed his goal of writing 1 haiku per day over a full year.    

Eric’s supports mental health peer recovery through involvement in th National Alliance for Mental Illness (NAMI,) The Stability Network, and Faithful Friends ministry.  

On a final note, Eric listens to some podcasts at 1.5x speed, so he is more than happy if you listen to Tony and him in chipmunk mode.

+     +     +

 

Tony grew up near Indianapolis, Indiana worshiping basketball, with delusions of playing for the Pacers. He went to Hanover College where he obtained a B.A. in English and theology. He then graduated with a Master's of Divinity from Louisville Presbyterian Seminary.

He went on to serve 20 years in pastoral ministry while living with bipolar disorder. In 2014, he published a spiritual memoir, Delight in Disorder: Ministry, Madness, Mission . He has written for a variety of magazines and journals, including Leadership, Presbyterians Today, and Upper Room.

Tony was a keynote speaker at the first "Shattering Stigma with Stories" conference in Lake Oswego (OR), and the co-founder (along with Eric Riddle) of the "Faithful Friends" mental health support group. He is inspired by Americana music; John Prine is his muse.

He has written for a variety of magazines and journals, including Leadership, Presbyterians Today, and Upper Room.Tony was a keynote speaker at the first "Shattering Stigma with Stories" conference in Lake Oswego (OR), and the co-founder (along with Eric Riddle) of the "Faithful Friends" mental health support group. He is inspired by Americana music; John Prine is his muse.

story:
The Show

Inn Between is a fantasy-adventure fiction podcast that focuses on found family, friendship, and the important moments between adventures that help us grow. Our first two seasons were fantastic, but our actors were volunteers, and that's not how we'd like to operate anymore. We're gearing up for our third season, and we need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to raise $3000 in order to pay our actors and transcriber a fair wage for their time and work, and to offset other costs. Here's the breakdown:

  • 62% is going to our five main actors to record fourteen episodes
  • 12.5% is going to our secondary cast
  • 18.5% is going to our transcriber, who will be in charge of all fourteen episodes plus bonus episode transcripts
  • 7% for other miscellaneous costs, like commissions requests for poster art and the new logo, as well as cloud storage and website upkeep.

And for you, we have lots of great perks: stickers, posters, early access to bonus episodes, a 12k-word Jazz Age heist AU of seasons 1&2, and even writing advice or a D&D game with Hannah!

Even if we don't reach our goal, everyone will get paid; this is to offset costs on one individual and make sure that all payment is coming through promptly.

The Impact

Season three will happen no matter what, but with your help, we can ensure a good experience for everyone involved, and make sure Hannah has the time, focus, and energy to make the best possible story. We are so excited to show you what we've got in store, and we want to make it the best season we can.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't give at this time? You can also help us by spreading the word! Not just about the crowdfund, although we sure would appreciate that. Tell your friends about the show itself! We could always use more people who listen to and love the show.

Thank you for your support!

story:
My name is Gregg, and I'm the host of a music podcast called Gregg's Guide to New Music. I have been podcasting for over 4 years, and have 173+ episodes available. It's time for some equipment upgrades. 

I'm looking to raise $600 to upgrade my mixer to a Behringer XENYX X2222USB 22-Channel Mixer, 2x Behringer B-2 microphones, 3 mic stands, and a Tascam TM-AR1 Microphone Reflection Filter. I've got some pretty cool rewards for contributions.

story:
Night White Skies is looking to grow.  The current podcast is a show about architecture’s future as earth’s environment and our human bodies are now open for design.

Growing the show includes transitioning to seasons as well as providing videos of each recorded conversation while maintaining the availability of the audio podcasts.

 

Short Summary

Night White Skies began with the goal of integrating current discourse of an evolving climate and human body with the discipline of architecture and design.  The conversations between guests and myself each week are an attempt to foreshadow opportunities and repercussions just on the horizon.  As a professor of architecture that has written and edited several books on the subject matter alongside maintaining a design office of my own, Night White Skies has been a vehicle for communicating and exploring this discourse.

 

What Has Been Done So Far

Night White Skies has released nearly 30 episodes in just over the last year as podcasts available on iTunes, Soundcloud and Stitcher.

Night White Skies is looking to make a season II, consisting of 12 episodes released each Monday beginning February 5th - April 23rd which will incorporate videos of the conversations as well as continuing to provide the audio podcasts.

 

What is Needed & What You Get

As you can imagine, a lot of time, effort and funding has gone into developing the show to where it is today (along with a lot of enjoyment on my part).  The goal of this project is to raise the additional funds to cover equipment, editing software & staging to both grow and continue the show.

$5,000 :  Season 2 (10-12 episodes) available as video episodes on YouTube as well as an audio podcasts, both available each Monday for three months. 

Stretch Goals!

$10,000 :  Straight into season 3…to be released next fall 2018 with another dozen episodes!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t support the show today, no worries….just enjoy the content already available!

Night White Skies is available on ITunes right now! Go and have a listen and if you enjoy it, help spread the word by either sharing the Indiegogo link, giving it a ‘like’ on iTunes or just mentioning it to a friend.

Thanks!

Past Episodes

story:
What is Latitudes?

Latitudes is a coast to coast audio documentary project starting June 2018.

We are a pair of students and audiomakers who will be biking the TransAmerica trail (4,228 miles, from Oregon to Virginia), microphones and recording gear in tow. On each day of the journey, we will be recording an audio postcard - no more than 15 seconds long. Listening should feel like stepping directly into another pair of coordinates. As the project unfolds, we hope to present a rich, intimate portrait of our country as it sounds right now, a few seconds and miles each day.

You can already follow along! To get each postcard as they're released, you can subscribe to our podcast feed on iTunes, get them delivered to your inbox, or just follow along at our website.

How can I make this happen?​

We don't need much! $4,000 is all we need to cover the cost of food (at approximately $10 a day per person over our 80 day trip) and equipment, which includes our recording gear, bicycles and new tires, and a lightweight tent for shelter.

One thing we don’t need to cover is lodging! We will be using the WarmShowers network to stay with hosts along the trail where we can, and sleeping in the tent otherwise.

How will we thank you?

To thank you for helping us cross the country, we’ll acknowledge your support on the project website and podcast descriptions (featured on every platform where the podcast is distributed). We’ll also thank all of our supporters by name in the credits of our final, retrospective episode once we reach our final destination!

Who are you, anyway?

Max Vilgalys is a PhD student at MIT’s Institute for Data, Systems, and Society. He’s worked at the intersection of computer science and energy policy in California, Colorado, Washington, DC, and Hamburg, Germany. His photo series on Antarctica was featured by the Stanford Student Organizing Committee for the Arts, and he has biked thousands of miles in trails around the US and Germany.

Catherine Wong is a computer science master’s student at Stanford University and a producer for the State of the Human, the award winning radio show and podcast of the Stanford Storytelling Project. She has also produced nonfiction podcasts, audio documentaries, and digital, data-driven news for the Stanford English department and WNYC’s podcast division.

What are some other ways I can help?​

Spread the word! Seriously. The cycling community is loving and wonderful and we already wouldn't have dreamt of starting this project without your words of wisdom. If you can't help fund us, but can share the project with someone who can, that's what will keep us rolling.

And we'd love to send our postcards to you! You can subscribe to our podcast feed on iTunes or  sign up to get them delivered to your inbox.

story:
*NOTE:  This campaign may be shared 1:1 via email and DM but not posted to PWLT as it is a surprise.  Please don't spoil the surprise for Jeremy, and we've confirmed he is able to attend.

 

Help Send Jeremy Collins to CrimeCon

So let's talk a little more about this guy and why we want to help send him to CrimeCon.

    In a year Jeremy, along with the help of his page admins, grew Podcasts We Listen to from a community of 100 members to almost 8000.  Every day each of us have a place to interact with one another, share our favorite podcasts, and learn about shows we might never otherwise discover.  And he manages to keep us all in line.  He supports listeners, hosts and now with the launch of Podcasts We Listen To, the Podcast, he gives all of us a behind the scenes look into the lives, thoughts, and creative process of some of our favorite podcasters.

    Jeremy already has a plan for what he would do at CrimeCon - snackable audio interviews with so many hosts and listeners, and broadcast as close to live as you can get every day from the convention.  Plus, his presence there is feet on the street convention research for the upcoming PODCON2018 - a convention he started and is now planning with help from listeners and hosts to continue giving us all a place where we can literally come together, meet podcasters from EVERY GENRE, learn, be entertained, all in one of the most incredible cities in the country - New Orleans!

    Here's What We Need

    We're looking to surprise Jeremy and cover his CrimeCon Expenses, which we anticipate total $1500.  And we want to be completely transparent with you so we've itemized the costs below.  The cost of event registration reflects a 20% off discount with a podcast coupon code.

    • Event Registration - $400
    • Airfare - $400
    • Hotel Accommodations - $500
    • Incidentals - $200

    What Does This Mean For You?

    Jeremy Collins' wants to go to CrimeCon and bring it back to YOU! There are so many folks who are unable to attend and are asking for videos, audio, photographs, etc.  Many of the podcast hosts attending will be manning our booths at podcast row, attending meet ups and convention activities.  Jeremy will be your feet on the street, and ours, to bring everyone as much as he can from this event.  Plus, what he observes and experiences will shape how we develop and host PODCON2018.

    Is there a Risk?

    Here's the great thing about Indiegogo - they're flexible.  If for some reason we don't raise the entire $1500, Jeremy will still receive whatever we raise to offset his CrimeCon expenses. Any money raised over $1500 will go into the budget for PODCON2018.

story:
The Rundown

Who promotes others anymore? Who collaborates? How else can we express our creativity? Can family and business mix? Say no more. Let's build about it and show and prove.
 
Strong Ty's: Nothing Professional, Strictly Creative, hosted by filmmaker Shawn Strong, his photographer cousin Tylon Ross of Tylon Ross Photography, and Shawn Strong's wife, Naj, a London-born Moroccan fashionista and cook. Strong Ty's will be a 1-hour live video podcast & talk show airing on Sundays facilitated at M. Lewis Lifestyle Boutique in Newburgh, NY. The show will be filled with interactive episodes of segments sharing our creative experiences, creative tools, and knowledge on media and creativity. It will be entertaining, informative with invited special guests and call-ins from the community on specific topics.
 

Who We Are

Shawn Strong
Filmmaker and creative, one of the founders of Hudsy.TV, a digital curation site and original content platform of the Hudson Valley NY. Owner of Phanatiks Entertainment, a video and digital media production company and creator of Phan Media, an online creative arts platform for local artists, businesses and venues.
Tylon Ross
A Newburgh native who captures moments through digital photography. A valuable part and asset of Phanatiks Entertainment, Phan Media and Hudsy. A dope photographer.
Najat Elabouri
London-born Moroccan wife of Shawn Strong, who has a knack for Moroccan cooking and UK fashion lifestyle. She brings balance and an outside accent to our seasoning. Or she is the seasoning. 
 
Our team will expand as we grow.
 
 
 
We will be telling our stories, our way, to those who are familiar with us and the rest of the world, an introduction. That's how communities grow by speaking to each other. We're going to do it in an innovative matter and format. We built our reputations by doing the groundwork, supporting local artists and events, creating awareness and bringing life during and after the fact. 
We are not following a trend; we are raising a bar that pushes others and us by any means creative. We need your support in doing so.
 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $5,000

  • Equipment to make us crystal clear and radio-ready
  • Continue to produce (design, edit and write) shows 
  • Promotion (initial and ongoing) of the show, segments, and content
  • Create more unique local merchandise to sell
  • Podcast and web hosting
  • Legal services and or licensing for music and video content
  • Fees
We have perks for our community, businesses, artists, producers, models and more.
 
If we exceed our goal, which we hope we do, we'll be able to hire a local creative and or an assistant to be a part of the team.
 
Community
All supporters can get from shout outs, t-shirts, hats to lunch and dinner made by our co-host Naj. That's British-Moroccan specialties made right there, personally for you!
 
Businesses
Get your business and establishment promoted in visual forms with commercials and or ongoing social media promotion. And of course, we'll be blasting you and taking time out for our commercial sponsors to give you your due time. This will not just be a one-off! This is how self-sustaining communities grow. We elevate and promote one another. 
 
Producers
For producers and beatmakers, we have an excellent perk package for you. Have your beats as the soundtrack to an episode. Your beats will be our opening music and sound beds on certain, selected episodes. Of course, we'll shout you out and let folks know where and who to get the hottest beats from. We're the plugs!
 
Models
You want to be seen. We'll make that possible. Packages for the stylish. We have perks for YOU to be on the cover of our promotional materials either for the episodes or for the month. Your choice. These packages come with photoshoots and the right stuff to exposure your beauty in this cross-promotional incentive.
 
Designers
You have a brand or a clothing line? No matter how dope your pieces are, if you no one sees it, no one will know. We got that perk that will not only get your brand and line seen but also heard. We'll do a full spread for you and continuous promotion on our show. And we'll rock your gear!
 

The Impact

Promotion and marketing is the most ignored component in our creative communities, along with funding and education. How do we get it? How do we invest in each other and ourselves? How do we engage with people in divergent networks? Well, let's talk about it, and keep talking about it until it connects into becoming the self-sustaining elements our communities need. This is an opportunity to do more and speak louder. Strong Ty's podcast talkshow can and will be huge for our area and beyond. It will speak volumes, and you all are contributors in making this happen.
 
Conversations, awareness, collaboration, promotion, and progression. The ingredients to something great.
 

Risks & Challenges

Independent podcasts and shows like ours have no corporate backing and are all supported by our believing, creative community or ourselves who want to see us all grow and flourish. We are deeply tied to the independent creative community.  These upgrades will advance our creativity and endeavors.
 
Our highest priorities in this project are as follows:
  1. Delivering high quality, broadcast ready episodes of Strong Ty's podcast and talk show
  2. Delivering episodes on time 
  3. Delivering the stated rewards promptly
  4. Exceeding the expectations of our backers.
We’ll achieve these goals because:
  1. This is something we've wanted to do for some time, supported by passion.
  2. We've created year’s worth of content, including Phan Media, a creative arts web show in the past. We’ve produced Brew Houses, Vibe Talks with Lady Verse, and Starving Artists with Damel Di'Yari (totally independent) earlier this year. Our pre, production, and post workflows have been refined and we are routinely hired for video production from some of our local businesses (with the requisite deadlines/expectations to match).
  3. Strong Ty’s hosts are comprised of a full-time filmmaker/creative, a photographer, and a cook whose primary work consists of creating unique works. We wouldn't get hired if we didn't do what we say we will do or known for doing high-quality work. We will bring the same mentality and creativity to this project, if not more while conveying information, honesty, and authenticity. 
  4. Exceeding expectations, creating something memorable, and helping us connect through creativity, originality, and innovation that our area lacks. That's what we aim to do, every episode and beyond. 
If we're unable to reach our goal, we will humbly accept whatever is given and upgrade as much as we can.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone has money to spare OR, we do and just don't want to give. That's okay. We're asking for your support and your (money) investment in each other. If not, there's still plenty you can do to help!
  • Please tell all your friends about Strong ty's: Nothing Professional, Strictly Creative podcast talkshow and our campaign!
  • Please post about us on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, emails, texts and or any other way possible!
  • Remember you can use Indiegogo's built-in sharing tools!
 
We love you and greatly appreciate you.
 
- Shawn Strong, Ty Ross, and Naj

Strong Ty’s hosts are comprised of a full-time filmmaker/creative, a photographer, and a cook whose primary work consists of creating unique works. We wouldn't get hired if we didn't do what we say we will do or known for doing high-quality work. We will bring the same mentality and creativity to this project, if not more while conveying information, honesty, and authenticity. 
Exceeding expectations, creating something memorable, and helping us connect through creativity, originality, and innovation that our area lacks. That's what we aim to do, every episode and beyond. 

If we're unable to reach our goal, we will humbly accept whatever is given and upgrade as much as we can.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
We know not everyone has money to spare OR, we do and just don't want to give. That's okay. We're asking for your support and your (money) investment in each other. If not, there's still plenty you can do to help!

Please tell all your friends about Strong ty's: Nothing Professional, Strictly Creative podcast talkshow and our campaign!
Please post about us on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, emails, texts and or any other way possible!
Remember you can use Indiegogo's built-in sharing tools!

 
We love you and greatly appreciate you.
 
- Shawn Strong, Ty Ross, and Naj

story:
Who am I?

My name is Paul Privitera, I'm the creator and Dungeon Master behind "Des Moines and Dragons". I have been playing in / running games of Dungeons and Dragons (DND) since I was 16 years old. Creating stories in this art-form for so long has given me a passion and desire to see the DND community grow and thrive.

I have a degree in Theater from Simpson College. I am currently 5 years into running the oldest Longform Improv team in Des Moines. These achievements have made me an expert at producing live performances.

Who are we?

The cast of Des Moines and Dragons stretches across multiple artistic disciplines to deliver quality content that, before, was only available in audio. With our combined musical, theatrical, and comedic backgrounds our cast is uniquely positioned to make some of the most dynamic DND centered entertainment that is filmed here in Des Moines Iowa.

Charity Coons- improviser and standup comedian featured in dozens of shows across the metro area

Jason Monroe- decades performing guitar and music currently in both bands Superchief and Son of the Morning.

Tim Overton- improv coach and performer, taught college debate and has travelled all across the midwest for comedy.

Chris Williams- Sound designer, actor, Bard? Degree in Theater and 10 years of experience in technical theater.

Find out more at our website: Des Moines and Dragons

 

What are you doing?

Today I'm asking for crowdfunding to secure the resources needed to produce a live show of DND. Being able to have a highly produced and well shot DND Live Show  gives the audience a great piece of content to enjoy, and gives folks who may be interested in the hobby- a reason to jump in and make their own game!

This live show will follow our main campaign, but setup in a way to allow both new and returning listeners to enjoy  a game of DND from their couches or desks at home.

What's in it for you?

We are offering a variety of fun and unique perks for our supporters!

ART CARDS

  • Our Art Card features the artist "Lawful Mediocre" Custom character art for the Des Moines and Dragons show! We will sign every card and even include an in-character message for you!
  • EVERY Art Card get's a soldier in the final battle named after them. Your choice of name. In this final conflict the new Queen's army needs brave heroes.

​LIVE SHOW TICKETS + POSTER

  • We have 10 seats available at the Live Recording available for supporters of the show and folks who want to see what goes into a DSM&D Live show.
  • All tickets come with a signed Movie Poster promoting the Live Season Finale.

DUNGEON MASTER BOOT CAMP 

  • ​Join Dungeon Master Paul and all others at this tier for a live Dungeon Master tutorial. Session will last 2 hours and cover basic to advance tips and methods for making your own game!
  • You also get access to the DSM&D slack where you and other Dungeon Master's can hangout, ask questions, and participate in world building for the show.

YOUR OWN CHARACTER + POSTER

  • Our artist "Lawful Mediocre" has given us a deal for the Indie Gogo Campaign to draw your own character bust! 
  • Fantasy characters aren't the only thing this talented artist can draw! He can take whatever character you want drawn and give them his unique touch to produce a truly original piece! You could even request a rendering of your best friend to make for a one of a kind gift!
  • Not only do you get this Custom Character Bust, but you also get a physical copy of the Season Finale Movie Poster sent to you!

YOUR OWN ONE SHOT

  • ​If the idea of DM'ing isn't your thing, why not have Paul Dungeon Master a game for you? With this reward you get a full One Shot session for you and 3 friends to play whatever characters you want in whatever world you want.
  • You too will get access to the DSM&D slack where you and other Dungeon Master's can hangout, ask questions, and participate in world building for the show.

 

CONTINGENCY

  • Should we not meet our desired goal we would use what funds we collected to produce the show as best we can. We would reduce the amount of cameras to use a static angle camera shot on the entire cast for the show. This would avoid renting a video switcher.
  • All additional funds that take us over the Minimum Production Amount will be put into a profit sharing pool. This pool will be divided amongst all the creatives involved in this project to help pay for their time given.

 

What We Need 

Here is how we've calculated costs so you understand why we are asking for funding:

Estimated Total Cost $800

Hardware $599

  • $249 BlackMagic ATEM 4K HD Video Switcher

    • This will allow our video producer to switch camera angles on the fly and create an immersive and engaging show

  • $29/ $145 (each) 5 Sony A6000 Mirrorless Cameras

    • These will be the cameras we use to capture the players, the dice, and the soundbard as we create a live DND show- on the fly!

  • $26 / $130  (each) 5 Compatible Lenses for Cameras

  • $75 Show Materials

    • This includes notebooks, set dressing, cables, homemade lighting, and building the background

Artist Compensation

  • $161
    • ​Paying good talent is required to producing quality entertainment. We will be paying our video producer first and any extra money will be split evenly among the cast.

Rewards $40

  • $40 Art Cards and Posters for Supporters

    • We are getting both the Posters and Supporters printed on high quality paper from Vista Print

 

The Impact

Your contribution to this campaign will mean that Des Moines will get it's own place to call Dungeons and Dragons home:

  • We will be able to have bigger and better live events that draw more people
  • With more people playing DND it'll be easier to find games and play 
  • DSM&D has already produced 3 live shows in the past including 1 at the titular Gary Con in Lake Geneva Wisconsin

 

Risks & Challenges

Producing Live Video is extremely difficult. It's partially why the endeavor is so expensive. There are any number of technical issues that can prevent a live video being made on time and without issue.

Part of paying for a Video Producer is to eliminate the risk of equipment failure or glitch. We are all also very experienced live performers with plenty of skill in the arena of "adapt and overcome" any obstacle in our way to deliver a top notch quality show.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you aren't in a financial position to donate, we can still use your help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Use our Indiegogo Share tools to let folks know about this uniquely Des Moines project!

story:
Who We Are

Asylum 94 Productions is a family-run, independent production group founded by husband-and-wife team Mike and Jen Gagne. We love podcasts, we've been listening to them for years, and we decided this is the best medium to tell the stories we've had in our heads for nearly as long. With a healthy dose of  the macabre; our stories delve into mental illness, cosmic horror and weird fiction. Occulting (3) 15, the second season of Boston Harbor Horror, follows the newly-minted Coast Guard Investigative Service Agent Alex Devereaux as he investigates the murder of four Coast Guard members - apparently by one of their own.

The Story

The season opens with veteran Rhode Island State Police Detective Ashley Carter interviewing the sole suspect, Boatswain's Mate First Class Valentina Morales, about what occurred the night before. Petty Officer Morales, still in a state of shock, explains that something…unnatural occurred during the night - her duty section had disappeared, and the lighthouse, which normally flashes white, was glowing a deep, blood red. Special Agent Devereaux is called in to assist Detective Carter in the investigation.

Occulting (3) 15 will be told over the course of 14 episodes with an average run time of 15-20 minutes each. Episodes are written and sound-designed by Mike Gagne and rigorously edited by Jen Gagne, the co-creators of Asylum 94 Productions. Production assistance is provided by Amy McNally and Boot McNally of the Wander podcast. Original music is composed by Josh Monroe of Graven Rogue Studios.

The Asylum 94 Staff

Mike Gagne is the creator, writer, and sound designer for the Boston Harbor Horror series, as well as the voice of Alex Devereaux. As a veteran, he brings a unique perspective from years of direct military experience to his storytelling.

Jen Gagne is the Asylum Director, casting director and script editor, who adds the fine, creative details that really make our stories shine.

Amy McNally is the creator, writer and lead voice actor of the newest Asylum 94 production, Wander. She also assists with casting and script editing for Boston Harbor Horror.

Boot McNally is the producer of Wander, in addition to providing script editing, production assistant and assistant casting director for Boston Harbor Horror.

Josh Monroe is the founder of Graven Rogue Studios and the creator, writer, sound designer and composer of the audio dramas The City Within The Walls and We Be Pirates.

How Can I Help?

Asylum 94 is a group of friends that love making podcasts. We tell stories, whether it's through tabletop roleplaying games, written short stories or immersive Audio Fiction. The only way we can do this is with the help of others. We put a lot of work into what we produce, and strive for high quality audio entertainment. The most crucial part of any of these productions is the voice talent. Without them, a podcast is only words on paper, text on a screen. We want to give back to the wonderful people who volunteer their time, energy, effort and money putting their voices to our stories, and putting those stories into the world for our audience to hear. That is why the majority of the funds we raise here will go directly to them.

 It takes a certain amount of courage to stand in front of a microphone, put yourself into the shoes of another, and read someone else's words to tell a story to the world. Below is how this Indiegogo campaign will support the newest installment of Boston Harbor Horror:

Primary Characters: $50.00 per episode

Secondary Characters: $25.00 per episode

Total Actor Expense: $2,850.00

Composer: $400.00

Custom Artwork: $500.00

IndieGoGo Hosting and Administrative Fees: 5%, $250.00 (est)

Total Cost: $4,000.00

Exceeding Our Goal

What if you exceed your goal?

In the case we exceed our fundraising goal, additional funding will be sent towards the amazing people who took a chance with a novice writer and producer, and volunteered their voices to bring Boston Harbor Horror Season One to our wonderful audience. Thanks to the work and effort by those 36 voice actors, Season One has had nearly 30,000 downloads and boasts over 800 subscribers.

story:
Die lange Geschichte, kurz:

Hi! Ich bin Clemens. Die Stoerenfriede sind seit 2018 mein Weg, Euch an den Gesprächen teilnehmen zu lassen, die ich führe. Meine Gäste sind Politiker, Musiker, Kulturschaffende und Unternehmer aus Mitteldeutschland. Inzwischen wird aller zwei Wochen eine neue Episode veröffentlicht: für 2020 sind spannende Neuerungen geplant, darunter Livestreams und eine Debatten-Veranstaltung.

Momentan findet ihr den Podcast im Web und auf

  • Spotify
  • iTunes Podcasts
  • Google Podcasts (mobile)
  • ... und in jedem Player, der RSS-Feeds abonnieren kann!

Die Ursache

Leider hat mein Laptop kurz vor der Veröffentlichung der ersten Episode 2020 den Geist aufgegeben. Die Reparatur ist etwa so teuer wie das gesamte Gerät. Da ich gern schnellstmöglich wieder auf die Füße kommen will, würde ich mich freuen, wenn wir das gemeinsam stemmen könnten!

Für eine möglichst frustrations-freie Arbeitsweise benötige ich einen Rechner, der etwa so leistungsfähig ist, dass er ein dreistündiges Ableton-Projekt aushält. ;) 

Die Wirkung

Natürlich wird es den Podcast auch ohne diese Kampagne weiterhin geben. Es macht viel zu viel, Spaß, um sich von einem kleinen Rückschlag aufhalten zu lassen: aber mit Deiner Hilfe kann es schneller gehen.

Mit Spenden, die ich im Dezember erhalten habe (Lori, Richard, Flo) konnte ich mir ein kleines Stativ und ein Smartphone-Objektiv leisten: entsprechend werden künftige Aufzeichnungen als Live-Stream stattfinden, sodass Ihr Fragen an meine Gäste stellen könnt.

Die Stoerenfriede sind ein Format von uns, für uns. Das war schon immer so. 

Andere Möglichkeiten

Natürlich ist eine Spende nicht der einzige Weg, die Stoerenfriede zu unterstützen:

  • Bewerten! Die Stoerenfriede sind bei Apple Podcasts und auf vielen anderen Plattformen verfügbar: damit man dort erfährt, ob das Format etwas taugt, kannst Du gern eine Bewertung oder gar ein Review schreiben. 
  • Teilen! Auch wenn Du selbst die Kampagne nicht unterstützt, ist Deine Reichweite von unschätzbarem Wert. (Unschätzbar, wie in: kann nichts bringen. Oder alles.) Wenn Du möchtest, teile die Indiegogo-Kampagne oder meinen Podcast in Deinen Netzwerken. Danke!
  • Kommentieren! Jeden Tag lösche ich fünf Kommentare von Bots, die mir Sneaker verkaufen wollen. Ich freue mich über jeden Hörer, der auf der Website seine Meinung zu einer der Episoden äußert.
  • Diskutieren! Podcasts können schnell zu einem sehr passiven Medium werden. Das Gegenteil wäre mir lieber. Sag mir, wen ich einladen soll - und wen ich lieber nicht hätte einladen sollen. Erzähl mir, welche Fragen Du gestellt hättest. Es kann (fast) nur besser werden!

Ich danke Dir.

Clemens - Stoerenfriede

story:
Resumen

 

La información debe ser libre. En ClaraMENTE creamos contenido informativo con un estilo frontal que busca responder las preguntas que los medios tradicionales pasan por alto. El trabajo que realizamos conlleva, además de equipos, varios gastos que comprenden la compra de insumos, así como la movilidad.  Como nuestro contenido no tiene ataduras, ni busca favorecer a ningún sector ni personalidad, es un  poco apetecible para la colocación de publicidad, sobre todo cuando los principios que dieron nacimiento al proyecto no están en venta.  por eso necesitamos de cada uno de ustedes. Con su aporte, por más pequeño que sea podremos seguir adelante.

 

¿Cómo se usarán los fondos?

 

  • Compra de equipo que ayuda a mejorar la calidad de lo que hacemos
  • Reparaciones de equipos
  • Insumos (Baterías, protectores de equipo, etc)
  • Costo de transporte (Combustible, pasajes, etc)
  • Pago de servicios (Alquiler de equipos, servicios de ilustración, etc).
 

 

 

¿Qué obtienes?

 

Obvio por tu ayuda no te dejaremos con las manos vacías. Por eso hemos puesto como recompensa impresiones de las mejores fotografías de Mauricio Valenzuela, uno de los miembros del equipo, que cuenta con reconocimiento de su trabajo a nivel internacional. El ejemplar que recibirás por tu donación de 20 dólares en adelante será impreso en un tamaño de 8"x12" y firmadas por el autor.

Compra de equipo que ayuda a mejorar la calidad de lo que hacemos
Reparaciones de equipos
Insumos (Baterías, protectores de equipo, etc)
Costo de transporte (Combustible, pasajes, etc)
Pago de servicios (Alquiler de equipos, servicios de ilustración, etc).
  
 ¿Qué obtienes?
 
Obvio por tu ayuda no te dejaremos con las manos vacías. Por eso hemos puesto como recompensa impresiones de las mejores fotografías de Mauricio Valenzuela, uno de los miembros del equipo, que cuenta con reconocimiento de su trabajo a nivel internacional. El ejemplar que recibirás por tu donación de 20 dólares en adelante será impreso en un tamaño de 8"x12" y firmadas por el autor.

story:
Chasing a Dream 

Podfest was born on August 5th, 2013 at a meetup I hosted with 13 attendees!  Here are our highlights from that point forward! 

  • In 2014 Chris Krimitsos holds 2 workshops around Podcasting 
  • 2015 1st Official Podfest is held April 24th-26th  100 Attendees 
  • 2016 2nd Podfest Feb 26 & 27th 181 attendees. Podfest Pioneers the Gratitude closing ceremony. The Messengers: A Podcast Documentary starts filming at Podfest 2016
  • 9/13/2016 The Messengers reaches 123% of Goal raised with $22,152 becoming the 1st Documentary funded by the community for the medium of podcasting
  • Feb 23-25th 2017 Podfest Moves to Orlando to help demand from Intl Travelers The Messengers: A Podcast Documentary Premiers to a standing ovation 373 Registered Attendees.
  • 2018 Podfest keeps growing 496 Attendees. Holds the 1st Ever Friars Roast of a Podcaster Dave Jackson of the School of Podcasting 
  • 2019 Podfest March 7-9th 975 Attendees Doubles in size 975 Attendees Launch of Vidfest The Roast of John Lee Dumas 
  • 2020 Podfest doubles in size with over 2000 Registered Attendees Last conference to go on prior to Coronavirus shutting everything down Podfest Launches Microcons to rave reviews. Podcast Editor Con, Audio Drama Con, Military Creator Con, and many more targeted brands for sponsors to partake in. 

Be part of the Podfest story as we take on the largest undertaking to date. 

This Summer we have Partnered with WHOVA our Tech platform to Bring Podfest to life and are Officially going for a record-setting attempt to host the World's Largest Podcasting Conference Virtually this Aug 10th-17th!

What We Need & What You Get

  • The Bandwidth needed for this undertaking Technologically is immense we need your support helping us raise the funds needed to connect the world together! 
  • We have put together Perks for those that want to help us START UGLY as we bring the world together giving them education and camaraderie that our community has built within it! 
  • The Funds from this crowdfunding will help us cover the team behind the scenes helping put this on as well as keep a freemium option viable helping people from continents outside North America participate without having to purchase a ticket.

The Impact

This is a global undertaking that is intended to bring what we do so well Community, Collaboration, and Education to peoples homes the world over. 

  • We believe everyone should have access to the richness of the Podfest community.
  • We have been helping people since 2013 in this endeavor.
  • This record attempt is special because it begins almost 7 years to the day it all began so long ago with 13 people.

Risks & Challenges

We have put it all on the line to make this happen and believe that in life the most important thing to focus on is helping others get their message out to the world.

  • We will be partnering up with local podcast meetups & Groups across the globe bringing them under the Podfest umbrella and allowing the cross flow of information to disseminate freely! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  •  You Can help us make some noise about this campaign by sharing out.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
What are we doing?

Whimsic Productions is bringing you two new podcasts!

  • Dungeons & Drimbus: An actual-play D&D podcast guaranteed to be full of hilarious characters, absurd mistakes, and plenty of laughs.
  • Should I Buy It, Though?: A review podcast where video game enthusiasts of varying degrees, skill levels, and preferences come together to decide whether the newest releases (or the occasional classic) is worth your hard-earned coin.

We're a bunch of geeky actors looking to bring you quality content, whether that be through becoming fantastical characters or giving our open and honest opinions on why Metal Gear Solid V is fantastic and Nick Palazzo is out of his mind if he thinks that Yakuza... we'll talk about that later. 

Why are we asking you for money to play pretend?

We're going to be doing what we love and sharing it with you. After every game we play, there's always a moment of wishing someone had thought to record the absurdity that ensued that evening. To actually do that and put it into a polished high quality podcast, we need to cover our initial costs:

  • Initial set up includes purchasing domain names, necessary recording equipment, and other software we need
  • As a video game review podcast striving to provide timely reviews, Should I Buy It, Though? will often have a usual upfront cost of ~$60 per person. We want to make sure you're only spending money on games worth buying! But that means we have to buy them first and that can add up week after week
  • Additional funds will go towards further improving the productions by allowing us to spend on:
    • Hiring actual artists for cover art, music (what's a high stakes mer-person duel in space without some ambiance?), logos, etc.
    • Purchasing of further required equipment and software (better editing tools, sound-proofing, new platforms and upcoming games, etc.)

What do you get for backing us?

Well, primarily our gratitude and two really great podcasts! But, we've put some thought into meaningful rewards we can offer to make our backers feel like a part of the fun. Additionally, we know not everyone may be interested in both shows, so we've made custom tiers that let you interact with your preferred production in fun, meaningful ways. We want to hear from you and incorporate the community into our work, so you can bet we'll be finding ways to do that even after this campaign is over.

  • Become our founding fathers (daddies?)! Or mothers. Our founding parents. By being generous enough to fund our silly ideas you'll get a special shout out in the credits of the show and our website. 
  • Each show has ways you can influence the content we'll be making
    • For Dungeons & Drimbus, we'll be launching with a special one-off campaign that will allow all of your suggestions to wreck havoc on our fantasy world. Namely, absurdly generous donors will get to build the characters we play and maybe even join us! And we get absolutely no say in the matter. Other rewards include having an NPC named after you (or anything of your choosing) and - for our full length campaign - the limited opportunity to fund a secret objective known only by you and the assigned player. 
    • For Should I Buy It, Though?  various reward tiers will grant you access to exclusive content and the ability to decide what we're going to play. You will of course be honored as Founding Parent here as well, but other rewards include access to donor-exclusive livestreams as we play the games we are reviewing, the ability to choose what game we play and review for an episode, and even the chance to play with us and come on the show!

We think these rewards are really exciting and we're hoping to get build and interact with our community here. If you have thoughts on something you'd really like to see in the future, please get in touch! We'll be looking to build on this in the future to make our content feel a little more like a conversation with all of you.

When does any of this start?

Right now! Our first episode of Should I Buy It, Though?  is available as you're reading this. We have defined purposes for both our shows. With Should I Buy, we really want to help you determine if that shiny new game is a good value proposition. We understand, as with anything, video games are a matter of taste so you can't just blindly take our word for it. That's why we've put together a group with varied interests to walk you through their thoughts. Episode 1 is an introduction so you can get to know us, our tastes, and how the show will work moving forward

As for Dungeons & Drimbus, we are currently hard at work building the world and characters you'll get to meet very soon. We want to make sure everything is clearly defined and our house rules are in order, so we'll be taking some more time with that. Our main campaign will be DM'd by Nick Benetatos and will follow an episodic structure as we progress throughout the campaign. But, Giancarlo Herrera will be DMing our first episode in a one-off that you will get the chance to shape (and be a part of) with your contributions! That first episode will drop in July, shortly after this campaign ends followed by the beginning of our main arc.

Until then, you've got the first episode of Should I Buy It, Though?  followed by our review of The Last of Us Part II later this month, so we'll be sure not to keep you waiting.

How else can I contribute?

Like we said, we want all our Whimsic Production shows to live and breathe and interact with all of you. So if you can't contribute now, don't fret

  • Follow us on twitter! @WhimsicProd @DrimbusPod @ShouldIBuyPod
    • Tweet at us and share this page! Word of mouth is one of the best ways to grow our community
  • Subscribe to our feeds and be sure to check out the currently available episodes
  • Check out our Patreon! It is going to be a great way to be a part of the community and shape our shows moving forward. We appreciate any support you want to give us, so we've put some thought into how we can stay connected and reward your generosity as we move beyond our initial launch period.

Subscribe to our feeds and be sure to check out the currently available episodes

story:
Listen To Untypical's Pilot Episode!

Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/user-826492281/untypical...

Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U2-GDPJsKCg&amp...

 

 

okay buddy that sounds cool but...

Untypical is a western science-fantasy audio drama reminiscent of Firefly.Our goal is to tell long, engaging adventure stories with an emphasis on bizzarre scenariosand character relationships, all set in an orginalworld unlike any world you’ve ever encountered.

 

 

Untypical is characterized primarily by the unique and fascinating world in which it takes place, and of course our take on audio-based fight scenes. 

"to include more than one fight scene that is longer
than just a couple of punches is something of a risk. 
Untypical takes that risk and proves them all wrong."
~Elena Fernandez-Collins

We've taken inspiration from modern trailer editing as well as Edgar Wright to create fight scenes where the sound effects sync with the songs, moving in a captivating rhythm that tells a story, momentum and a shifting sequence which brings fight sequences and combat into the audio drama medium like no one else. 

"Each gunshot, each punch syncs perfectly to the
music behind it. The tactic not only works in an
ear-candy sense but also helps orient the listener
and make the fights easier to follow: latching onto
a familiar rhythm or melody makes everything
feel less chaotic."
~ Podcast Problems

Below you will find a compilation of the three fight
scenes we created for Untypical's first episode.

 

 

The team behind Untypical is called EAST Corp Productions, and we've been making Audio Dramas for almost four years. Our longest running, most popular, series, Confessions of a Wasteland Pony has been running since 2014 and we have since added to that with a roster of stories such as Terminal Secrets, The Wasteland Survival Guide and now, of course,  Untypical.

 


 

Untypical is made possible by a talented and diverse cast and crew, who range from new, talented voices to multi-award winning and experienced Voice Artists, writers and Filmmakers. 

 

Writers

James Vermont - Lead Writer

James is an award-winning South African filmmaker with several audio dramas, films and TV shows under his belt. He has been honing his penmanship all his life and has spent the last 6 years working freelance as a writer. 

Wendy Crescent - Writer

Wendy Crescent is an upcoming author of romantic fiction from the Netherlands. She has spent 3 years honing her craft writing fan-fiction and original fiction, specializing in writing romance stories that cover adult themes in a mature manner. She has published a total of 23 pieces of fan-fiction and is currently working to finish her first novel.

Ian Van Der Walt - Writer

Ian van der Walt was a stationary procurement temp who knows nothing about storytelling. One day he bumps into James Vermont, and makes an offhanded reference to his love for the cult flick "Heat Vision." Now he is stuck here and doesn't know how to get out.

Cast

Needle Stitch - Jessica

"The instant Needle Stitch's protagonist came on the scene, I was sold"
~ Elena Fernandez-Collins

Needle Stitch joined EAST Corp voicing the lead in our "Wasteland Survival Guide" series despite it being her very first attempt at Voice Acting. Since then she has landed leading roles in several EAST Corp Productions such as Terminal Secrets and Untypical, eventually stepping in and working on the organizational elements of several productions and earning her place as the fourth permanent producer at EAST Corp.

Julia Morizawa - Delilah

Julia Morizawa is a Los Angeles based actor with extensive experience in film, television, theatre, web series and podcasts. Career highlights include the feature films Judas Kiss and Tied Up; TV appearances on Lewis Black's The Root of all Evil and ER; the title role in East West Players' production of Masha No Home; series regular roles on the web series Star Trek: Odyssey and Frontier Guard; and the lead role in the narrative podcast The Bright Sessions.

Dusty Rhoades - The Councilman

Smack dab in the tenor range, Dusty’s voice is that warm stack of pancakes on a cold Sunday morning. He has Audiobooks as well as characters in his resume.

Mr. Creepypasta - Benjamin Quiet

Mr. CreepyPasta is a popular reader of mature, terrifying stories. He finds great joy in giving his audience tales of terror in the audio format and has been plying his voice-fueled trade for many years.

Obab Scribbler - Lucille

Scribbler has been creating content online for over ten years and has proven herself as a fanfic writer, audiobook reader and confirmed geek. Also a book lover. And a comic book nerd. Ooh, ooh, and an Anime fan. Also, easily distracted by shiny things.

Cinder Script - Phade

A few years of silly voices at work and some mild shenanigans involving a shipment of wholesale rubber ducks, and she decided to give voice acting a try. Now she's shouting into a microphone in the most metrosexual manner possible. Eager to blow your minds (and chew the scenery,) Cinder Script voices the crazy awesome Phade and his mysterious and totally-not-a-ghost companion Zoe Yu. Enjoy the Chaos, its gonna be one heck of a lightshow!

Madeline Goshorn - Khora

Madeline plays the voice of Khora, the large motherly polar bear mayor, better watch out son. She is a pursuing voice actress living in LA and has been studying and practicing for nearly five years.

Cayla Simpson - Mira

Cayla Simpson is a twenty-year-old South African film student with ten years of vocal training and desire to add music to her resume. She uses this training to voice Mira the dragon, as well as a few other East Corp characters.

 

In January 2017 we started a Patreon, which provided enough budget for Untypical's first episode.... over the course of 10 months. Naturally, we don't want to spend the next year and a half funding the two remaining episodes of this first season so this campaign exists to expedite the process. 

 

EPISODE 2 - DAY ZERO

A mission gone wrong leaves the crew of The Dancer staring directly at their past selves, forcing them to confront who they used to be and what they’ve had to lose of themselves in order to survive. Our heroes watch the day the world changed.

 

EPISODE 3 - AFROPUNK

Jessica, Khora, and Delilah have lived interesting lives across the last 20 years. But not all of their adventures had happy endings and not everyone who has crossed their paths has left them with a positive experience. Afropunk sees the crew of The Dancer chases an old friend in an attempt to heal wounds and deal with past mistakes. This leads them to The New African Pride, the changed continent of Africa which has now become the sci-fi inspired powerhouse of The Twisting World.

 

BONUS EPISODE 1&2

(Dependant on stretch goals)

We step away from the crew of The Dancer and tell two self contained stories set elsewhere in The Twisting World with the goal of providing you a different glimpse at the expansive and imaginative universe we have created.

 

EPISODE 4 - FUTUREGIRL

(Dependant on stretch goals)

The most powerful people in The Twisting World are the Scions, remnants of a magical community whose ability to manipulate the magic within matter has ascended them to near godhood. However a young Scion has boarded The Dancer with the hopes of fleeing her people to live in Stonetown.

Jessica and her crew must reach Stonetown before the other nations and factions of The Twisting World capture the Scion and harness her power for themselves.



 

In any production, there are bound to be challenges, which means there are always risks for potential backers. 

  • What if you don't complete the episodes? 
    • Our team is being led by experienced filmmakers who have
      completed multiple projects over several years. We are confident
      in our ability to see this through to the end. 
  • What if the project is delayed? 
    • Delays can happen, as large-scale productions can be quite complicated. 
      Those of you who have listened to our pilot episode have an idea of how
      in-depth and complicated we've made our lives. 

      The pilot was completed 3 weeks prior to our original estimate of date, 
      however, if we are met with a delay in production we will be certain to
      communicate that very clearly with our backers. 
  • Any other risks you wanna share with us, buddy?
    • Like many audio dramas, our production team is scattered around the
      world, with members in Europe, Southern Africa, and North America. This can create
      issues of contacting each other, organizing meetings and keeping a tight
      production schedule. 
      Most of our team, especially the leadership, have worked on productions like
      this in the past, and have been able to work through these issues. 

 

STRETCH GOALS

$2300

Bonus Episode 1

The first of two bonus episodes which step away from the primary cast
and explore self-contained stories elsewhere in The Twisting World.

$2600

Bonus Episode 2

The second of the two bonus episodes which will continue the process of
telling more self-contained, experimental stories.

$3400

Full New Episode - Futuregirl

The most powerful people in The Twisting World are the Scions, remnants of a magical community whose ability to manipulate the magic within matter has ascended them to near godhood. However a young Scion has boarded The Dancer with the hopes of fleeing her people to live in Stonetown.

Jessica and her crew must reach Stonetown before the other nations and factions of The Twisting World capture the Scion and harness her power for themselves.

$4300

Increased Music Budget

We will increase the music budget to include fight scene songs composed from scratch that incorporate the fight sound effects as if they were instruments for a more refined and directed experience.

$5100

Choose Your Own Adventure

Are you a fan of Choose Your Own Adventure stories? Well, we are! Vermont has been looking for an excuse to make one for the longest time and this is how he is justifying it. So at this goal, we will create a Choose Your Own Adventure set in Untypical’s Twisting World that will be free to campaign backers of ANY TIER.

Now he is stuck here and doesn't know how to get out.CastNeedle Stitch - Jessica"The instant Needle Stitch's protagonist came on the scene, I was sold"~ Elena Fernandez-CollinsNeedle Stitch joined EAST Corp voicing the lead in our "Wasteland Survival Guide" series despite it being her very first attempt at Voice Acting.
