Career highlights include the feature films Judas Kiss and Tied Up; TV appearances on Lewis Black's The Root of all Evil and ER; the title role in East West Players' production of Masha No Home; series regular roles on the web series Star Trek: Odyssey and Frontier Guard; and the lead role in the narrative podcast The Bright Sessions.Dusty Rhoades - The CouncilmanSmack dab in the tenor range, Dusty’s voice is that warm stack of pancakes on a cold Sunday morning. He has Audiobooks as well as characters in his resume.Mr. Creepypasta - Benjamin QuietMr. CreepyPasta is a popular reader of mature, terrifying stories. He finds great joy in giving his audience tales of terror in the audio format and has been plying his voice-fueled trade for many years.Obab Scribbler - LucilleScribbler has been creating content online for over ten years and has proven herself as a fanfic writer, audiobook reader and confirmed geek. Also a book lover. And a comic book nerd. Ooh, ooh, and an Anime fan. Also, easily distracted by shiny things.Cinder Script - PhadeA few years of silly voices at work and some mild shenanigans involving a shipment of wholesale rubber ducks, and she decided to give voice acting a try. Now she's shouting into a microphone in the most metrosexual manner possible. Eager to blow your minds (and chew the scenery,) Cinder Script voices the crazy awesome Phade and his mysterious and totally-not-a-ghost companion Zoe Yu. Enjoy the Chaos, its gonna be one heck of a lightshow!Madeline Goshorn - KhoraMadeline plays the voice of Khora, the large motherly polar bear mayor, better watch out son. She is a pursuing voice actress living in LA and has been studying and practicing for nearly five years.Cayla Simpson - MiraCayla Simpson is a twenty-year-old South African film student with ten years of vocal training and desire to add music to her resume. She uses this training to voice Mira the dragon, as well as a few other East Corp characters. In January 2017 we started a Patreon, which provided enough budget for Untypical's first episode.... over the course of 10 months. Naturally, we don't want to spend the next year and a half funding the two remaining episodes of this first season so this campaign exists to expedite the process.  EPISODE 2 - DAY ZEROA mission gone wrong leaves the crew of The Dancer staring directly at their past selves, forcing them to confront who they used to be and what they’ve had to lose of themselves in order to survive. Our heroes watch the day the world changed. EPISODE 3 - AFROPUNKJessica, Khora, and Delilah have lived interesting lives across the last 20 years. But not all of their adventures had happy endings and not everyone who has crossed their paths has left them with a positive experience. Afropunk sees the crew of The Dancer chases an old friend in an attempt to heal wounds and deal with past mistakes. This leads them to The New African Pride, the changed continent of Africa which has now become the sci-fi inspired powerhouse of The Twisting World. BONUS EPISODE 1&2(Dependant on stretch goals)We step away from the crew of The Dancer and tell two self contained stories set elsewhere in The Twisting World with the goal of providing you a different glimpse at the expansive and imaginative universe we have created. EPISODE 4 - FUTUREGIRL(Dependant on stretch goals)The most powerful people in The Twisting World are the Scions, remnants of a magical community whose ability to manipulate the magic within matter has ascended them to near godhood. However a young Scion has boarded The Dancer with the hopes of fleeing her people to live in Stonetown.Jessica and her crew must reach Stonetown before the other nations and factions of The Twisting World capture the Scion and harness her power for themselves. In any production, there are bound to be challenges, which means there are always risks for potential backers. 
What if you don't complete the episodes? Our team is being led by experienced filmmakers who havecompleted multiple projects over several years. We are confidentin our ability to see this through to the end. 

What if the project is delayed? Delays can happen, as large-scale productions can be quite complicated. Those of you who have listened to our pilot episode have an idea of howin-depth and complicated we've made our lives. The pilot was completed 3 weeks prior to our original estimate of date, however, if we are met with a delay in production we will be certain tocommunicate that very clearly with our backers. 

Any other risks you wanna share with us, buddy?Like many audio dramas, our production team is scattered around theworld, with members in Europe, Southern Africa, and North America. This can createissues of contacting each other, organizing meetings and keeping a tightproduction schedule. Most of our team, especially the leadership, have worked on productions likethis in the past, and have been able to work through these issues. 

 STRETCH GOALS$2300Bonus Episode 1The first of two bonus episodes which step away from the primary castand explore self-contained stories elsewhere in The Twisting World.$2600Bonus Episode 2The second of the two bonus episodes which will continue the process oftelling more self-contained, experimental stories.$3400Full New Episode - FuturegirlThe most powerful people in The Twisting World are the Scions, remnants of a magical community whose ability to manipulate the magic within matter has ascended them to near godhood. However a young Scion has boarded The Dancer with the hopes of fleeing her people to live in Stonetown.Jessica and her crew must reach Stonetown before the other nations and factions of The Twisting World capture the Scion and harness her power for themselves.$4300Increased Music BudgetWe will increase the music budget to include fight scene songs composed from scratch that incorporate the fight sound effects as if they were instruments for a more refined and directed experience.$5100Choose Your Own AdventureAre you a fan of Choose Your Own Adventure stories? Well, we are! Vermont has been looking for an excuse to make one for the longest time and this is how he is justifying it. So at this goal, we will create a Choose Your Own Adventure set in Untypical’s Twisting World that will be free to campaign backers of ANY TIER.

story:
About our Podcast

No Homo takes a unique, comedic approach to current LGBTQ issues. In mainstream media, we always see queer stories presented as tragic and negative, and while these stories are not to be ignored, No Homo aims to take a different angle on the queer experience and make light of some of the negative issues we are exposed to daily. We tell real, raw stories and give our thoughts on the LBGTQ world of today based on our own experiences growing up as closeted homosexuals. We aim to make people laugh and help those just coming to terms with their sexuality understand that the journey they are about to embark on is much less scary than it may seem at first.

On the show, we discuss current topics of the gay pop culture and politics, play games, tell stories from our own unique gay perspectives, and interview others to learn about their experiences.

Help Us, Help You! 

Your gracious hosts, Eric Tate and Liz Stickley have been recording and collaborating worlds apart since Eric's been living abroad in South Korea, but their long-awaited reunion is just around the corner. While both are excited to be rid of unpredictable Skype sessions and finally able to record in the same room, the welcome change comes with a new set of challenges. 

The software we have been using will be useless recording together. We will need more advanced audio equipment to continue delivering to you the fabulous, flaming, fun content you've so enjoyed. 

With a donation fo $25 or more, contributors will receive an original No Homo Podcast t-shirt designed by our very own Eric Tate. 

Any contribution helps. Why spend your money on rainbow Bud Light this June, when you can make a direct impact on the queer community by donating to the No Homo podcast! 

Thank you for your continued support, gentle listeners!

story:
¿Por qué esta campaña?

España ha tenido un papel esencial en la Historia de Estados Unidos a lo largo de los últimos siglos, pero casi nadie conoce esta realidad. Por eso, desde The Hispanic Council, queremos dar a conocer a una serie de personajes españoles que forman parte de la cultura y la identidad tanto de Estados Unidos como de España. 

Después del éxito de la primera temporada de nuestro podcast “La otra historia”, dedicada a nombres como Ponce de León, Cabeza de Vaca, Vázquez de Coronado, Rodríguez Cabrillo, etc., queremos recuperar la figura de otros 10 españoles desconocidos que pisaron por primera vez el territorio actual de Estados Unidos: Alvarez de Pineda, Vázquez de Ayllón, Tristán de Luna, Hernando de Soto, Manuel de Montiano, etc.

 

A través de esta campaña queremos conseguir fondos para:

  • Producir y publicar la segunda temporada del podcast “La otra historia”, compuesta por 10 episodios tanto en español como en inglés sobre 10 personajes españoles que tuvieron un papel importante en Estados Unidos.
  • El primer episodio se publicará el miércoles 15 de septiembre, coincidiendo con el inicio del Mes de la Herencia Hispana, una celebración que se conmemora desde hace más de 50 años en Estados Unidos.  A partir de ahí, semanalmente publicaremos cada uno de los episodios.
  • Generar impacto en la opinión pública a través de los medios de comunicación y las redes sociales.
  • Contribuir a dar a conocer la importancia de las expediciones protagonizadas por estos 10 españoles cuyos esfuerzos resultaron capitales en la configuración de lo que hoy es Estados Unidos.

 

¿Qué necesitamos?

  • Que nos ayudes con tu aportación a cubrir los costes de la producción del podcast. Ya contamos con el 50% del presupuesto cubierto, pero necesitamos conseguir la financiación para el 100% del proyecto.
  • Que nos ayudes en la difusión de nuestros contenidos compartiéndolo con tus contactos en tus redes sociales, WhatsApp, etc.

 

¿Por qué colaborar?

  • Porque estarás contribuyendo a difundir la cultura hispana en España y Estados Unidos.
  • Porque es necesario que desde la sociedad civil y el mundo académico nos movilicemos frente a los intentos por manipular la Historia y el legado de hispano de Estados Unidos.
  • Porque disfrutarás de importantes ventajas: tu nombre en los agradecimientos del informe; acceso a nuestro Club de Amigos y muchas más.

story:
We, Liron Cohen and Mimi Torchin, started Lady Parts TV, a blog/Vlog dedicated to the women of television and film and the roles they play, as a venue to promote women's work in the media and to celebrate the shows and films we love.

Over the past couple of years, Lady Parts TV has grown into a space where fans can gather, share ideas and points of view, and have fun, and our interactive Vlog has become a community we cherish.

This is why we want to be able to keep it going.

However, you all know how much work we put into these Vlogs.

We need YOUR help.

You've enjoyed our interviews and our interactive discussions before. Let's keep them going! 

Please give as much and as often as you can and pick up fun perks in return. Most importantly, your support will help to keep a much needed feminist and lesbian space on the air!

Thanks and we look forward to interacting with you!

Most importantly, your support will help to keep a much needed feminist and lesbian space on the air!Thanks and we look forward to interacting with you!

story:
Mike and Jenny share a deep curiosity about the world around us. We were drawn to each other as we asked each other why humans act the way they do and what makes landscapes change. The Green River was the start of our story: We met on this river while teaching outdoor education. We have maintained a desire to see this river from source to sea as we want this river system to continue to be a part of our story. Our curiosity has drawn us to hear and collect the stories of others who are connected to this river. 

The One River Project will connect the wild headwaters of the Green/Colorado River in the Wind River Range of Wyoming, to the Gulf of California in Sonora, by boat. Along the way, Mike and Jenny will explore what wild rivers mean to people through scheduled interviews and serendipitous engagements, contributing to the 50th Anniversary of the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act and adding a chapter to the stories surrounding the beloved and exploited Colorado River. The team will record audio and film conversations with diverse stakeholders while traveling through WY, CO, UT, AZ and MX entirely under human power, primarily in a purpose-built whitewater dory. We have three goals in mind. First, to celebrate free-flowing rivers by collecting people’s stories through writing, sound, and film. Secondly, to connect people to the Green and Colorado rivers, each other and public lands, sharing insights and changes in the river though stories, observations, interviews, and interactive mapping. And lastly, to explore the protection of intact, free-flowing rivers and innovative solutions to water conflict. 

Your contribution to our journey will fund the technical tools necessary to collect stories. Mike and Jenny have been doing expeditions both personally and professionally over the last 20 years. Through our experiences, we know what outdoor gear will be most effective to get us down the river. Over the last two  years, we have been planning, building and collecting these necessary items. We have used our own funds for the majority of this collection along with some help from sponsors. What we do not have is the equipment needed to capture the stories in the professional quality that these stories deserve. Your donation will help us purchase the following items:

- Digital recorder and microphone

- Mirrorless Digital Camera

- POV Camera

- Memory Cards

- Batteries

- Waterproof Cases

- Hard Drive

- Tri-Pod

- Solar Charging Capability 

- Fuel/Food/Transportation Costs

Our goal is to raise $5000.00 to acquire the necessary equipment listed above. 

What do you get out donating? 

Your donation will help to capture photos, stories, high quality sound for pod-casts and professional resolution for film. Your efforts will help us effective document this journey in order to help connect others to this important river system and the people who live there. 

As an incentive, if you donate $50.00, we'll send a 10 pack of postcards with images from our expedition. Also, for every additional $50 you donate, you will have the choice of an 8x10 photo from our gallery of photos we collect along the journey. These perks will be available when we complete the journey - so you should get them around March of 2019. 

    We are not the first to make this trip from source to sea on the Colorado (though there have been few), nor are we the first to catalogue stories along the way. We might be the first though, to explore the issues of climate change, development and water scarcity through podcasts while traveling source to sea, which will help conservationists, water managers, researchers and public officials find socially supportable solutions to the problem. The physical and biological needs of healthy Colorado River System are known and emerging, but the social solutions to get there have not yet been fully formed. This project will help to change that.

    We are the right ones to tell the story because not only do we know, love and have lived in multiple areas from the headwaters to the Lower Colorado deserts, but we also have the technical, storytelling, social science and conservation experience to complete this project in an intelligent, sensitive and insightful way. We will be able to engage people along the river corridor, meeting them where they are.

    Having experience as professional guides as well as personal expeditions over the last 20 years, we are both fully aware of the risks involved in a journey like this. We are aware that we may not finish. This is something we both do not want to happen, as we both like to finish what we start. However we understand that it is highly possible to experience injury, illness or a natural disaster such as a flash flood. Both Mike and Jenny have maintained an updated Wilderness First Responder for the last 15 years. Mike is a Whitewater Rescue Technician and has been a river guide for 20+ years. Both Mike and Jenny taught for the National Outdoor Leadership School. Together, Mike and Jenny have over 18,000 river miles from their journey and work. This accounts for hundreds of days and nights on the river... and this is just our river experience.

    We are an efficient team, especially in the backcountry. We have encountered and effectively assisted in managing injury with students, friends and each other. Every other year, we spend 3 days practicing wilderness medicine and learn about the most effective and up to date treatment. If we experience a situation on the river, we will talk about and come up with the most effective and reasonable plan for the situation. 

    This ask is not easy for us. We have worked hard together to achieve our goals without asking for much outside help. We have put off this ask for over a year because both of us feel "weird" about publicly announcing an ask for help. We completely understand if you can't assist us financially. What would mean a lot to us are suggestions, ideas of people to interview, encouragement and your emotional support. 

    Thank you SO MUCH for taking the time to read about the One River Many Voices project.

story:
Why This Story? 

Well first, there's the obvious reason: several members of this team are RAs, and RAs are hilarious. But there's more.

Many of us on the team have recently graduated, while others will be graduating very soon. All of us have been asked MANY TIMES, "What are your plans after graduation?" Concealing the existential dread is difficult. 

While college is a time of exciting opportunities, it often feels like every decision made could determine your entire future. It's very frightening. Worse, it's difficult for us not to constantly compare ourselves to others. "This celebrity directed three films when they were my age? I must be behind." 

Childish is the story of characters who are all smack in the middle of this formative time of their lives. Constantly comparing themselves to others and worrying how they are perceived by their peers, they live their lives with an endless search for validation. We can relate.

Why A Podcast Musical?

Show creators Ryan Dorsey and Zachary Goldberg have spent the better part of their college careers working in and experimenting with audio production. Whether sound designing films, working at their university radio station, or managing their student-run podcast network, Whale Bus, the team has enjoyed discovering and inventing new ways to tell stories through audio. Audio isn't just film without visuals; audio is its very own storytelling medium. 

The only thing Dorsey and Goldberg enjoy more than telling stories through audio is working with an incredible team of other artists to make it happen. Some members of the Childish team love musicals, others love rap, and all come from wonderfully diverse backgrounds, bringing with them their own unique perspectives and experiences. A podcast musical seemed like the natural next step in the Whale Bus story. 

Meet The Story Team!

Zachary Goldberg // Co-Creator, Showrunner, Lyricist

RA Zachary is a senior studying Film & TV at NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts. Zachary's many passions include musical theater writing, swing dancing, and theme park history, among others. From co-founding Whale Bus and co-hosting one of its podcasts, Looking Back at Tomorrow, to working as a Disney World cast member, his experiences are just as varied. The only variable that remains constant in Zachary’s life is his pride over being crowned NYU’s 2015 Mini-Golf Champion.

Favorite Musical: Singin' in the Rain

Ryan Dorsey // Co-Creator, Writer, Director

Ryan Dorsey is one of the hosts of Looking Back at Tomorrow and also a co-founder of Whale Bus. In between listening to ungodly amounts of podcasts, Ryan enjoys increasingly obscure Simpsons quotes and reading bad 90's sci-fi books.

Favorite Rap Album: The Low End Theory

Sabeen Shalwani // Producer

Sabeen Shalwani is a filmmaker and artist based in New York City. Having grown up in Texas as one of the token “brown kids,” her minority status is something she is excited to be exploring through her art. When she’s not editing or producing, she can be found napping, trying new food, and stage managing musicals for kids.

Favorite Musical: Hairspray

Lucas Friedman // Composer

Lucas Elijah Friedman is an actor, composer, and writer. He graduated from Tisch Drama's Playwrights Horizons Theater School in December 2018. Born in NYC, raised in Portland, Oregon, Lucas has been described as "simultaneously 80 and 10 years old," "several meerkats standing on each others' shoulders," and "wait, is that Daniel Radcliffe??!?" Writing a musical has been a lifelong dream for Lucas, and he couldn't have picked a better bunch of collaborators.

Favorite Musical: Merrily We Roll Along

Kamau Wainaina // Rap Producer & Lyricist

Kamau Wainaina is a Kenyan artist and cereal connoisseur based in New York City. Specializing in the audiovisual, Kamau is intent on creating a world through a variety of different media that all can experience.  

Favorite Rap Album: Not Drowning but Waving by Loyle Carner

Favorite Podcast: Displaced by Vox Media

Favorite Musical: Les Miserables

Jasmine Elshamy // Writer

Jasmine is a senior at NYU who has spent the last few years in undergrad writing silly scripts and papers about how bad capitalism is. Aside from being a reality TV addict (a well-documented PumpHead), she loves a good musical, which is why she is so excited to be working on Childish!

Favorite Podcast: Las Culturistas, and she also loves Bad Bunny

Elyse Morales // Writer

Elyse Morales is a TV and film writer living in LA and trying her best. She is the producer of another Whale Bus show, Story Blocks. In her free time she rereads Lord of the Rings and hangs out with her roommate's cat.

Favorite Rap Song: "Dreams and Nightmares" by Meek Mill

Timeline

The episodes are written. The music is locked. We have an incredible cast. All that's left is to rehearse, record, and edit! We hope to finish recording in mid-May and release mid-summer!

We are so excited to have you along this journey with us. Check back on our Facebook and Twitter pages for updates on the production of Childish! 

What We Need & What You Get

We've made it this far, but we need your help to make it to the finish line. We still need funding to help us with the following: 

  • Music rights. Please help us in making sure we can pay to secure the rights to our music.
  • Food. We believe people have to eat. We are hungry artists (literally) who need the fuel to keep going!
  • Paying artists. We believe in paying artists for their hard work. Performers will receive a small stipend for their countless hours spent working. 

Make a contribution, and you can receive rewards of all kinds, from stickers to albums, to a producer credit on the project!

We need your help to bring this story to life. 

Thank you so much for your support. Please consider donating to this project, as well as sharing with your friends and family.
story_txt:
Why This Story? 
Well first, there's the obvious reason: several members of this team are RAs, and RAs are hilarious. But there's more.
Many of us on the team have recently graduated, while others will be graduating very soon. All of us have been asked MANY TIMES, "What are your plans after graduation?" Concealing the existential dread is difficult. 
While college is a time of exciting opportunities, it often feels like every decision made could determine your entire future. It's very frightening. Worse, it's difficult for us not to constantly compare ourselves to others. "This celebrity directed three films when they were my age? I must be behind." 
Childish is the story of characters who are all smack in the middle of this formative time of their lives. Constantly comparing themselves to others and worrying how they are perceived by their peers, they live their lives with an endless search for validation. We can relate.
Why A Podcast Musical?
Show creators Ryan Dorsey and Zachary Goldberg have spent the better part of their college careers working in and experimenting with audio production. Whether sound designing films, working at their university radio station, or managing their student-run podcast network, Whale Bus, the team has enjoyed discovering and inventing new ways to tell stories through audio. Audio isn't just film without visuals; audio is its very own storytelling medium. 
The only thing Dorsey and Goldberg enjoy more than telling stories through audio is working with an incredible team of other artists to make it happen. Some members of the Childish team love musicals, others love rap, and all come from wonderfully diverse backgrounds, bringing with them their own unique perspectives and experiences. A podcast musical seemed like the natural next step in the Whale Bus story. 
Meet The Story Team!
Zachary Goldberg // Co-Creator, Showrunner, Lyricist

RA Zachary is a senior studying Film & TV at NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts. Zachary's many passions include musical theater writing, swing dancing, and theme park history, among others. From co-founding Whale Bus and co-hosting one of its podcasts, Looking Back at Tomorrow, to working as a Disney World cast member, his experiences are just as varied. The only variable that remains constant in Zachary’s life is his pride over being crowned NYU’s 2015 Mini-Golf Champion.
Favorite Musical: Singin' in the Rain
Ryan Dorsey // Co-Creator, Writer, Director

Ryan Dorsey is one of the hosts of Looking Back at Tomorrow and also a co-founder of Whale Bus. In between listening to ungodly amounts of podcasts, Ryan enjoys increasingly obscure Simpsons quotes and reading bad 90's sci-fi books.
Favorite Rap Album: The Low End Theory
Sabeen Shalwani // Producer

Sabeen Shalwani is a filmmaker and artist based in New York City. Having grown up in Texas as one of the token “brown kids,” her minority status is something she is excited to be exploring through her art. When she’s not editing or producing, she can be found napping, trying new food, and stage managing musicals for kids.
Favorite Musical: Hairspray
Lucas Friedman // Composer

Lucas Elijah Friedman is an actor, composer, and writer. He graduated from Tisch Drama's Playwrights Horizons Theater School in December 2018. Born in NYC, raised in Portland, Oregon, Lucas has been described as "simultaneously 80 and 10 years old," "several meerkats standing on each others' shoulders," and "wait, is that Daniel Radcliffe??!?" Writing a musical has been a lifelong dream for Lucas, and he couldn't have picked a better bunch of collaborators.
Favorite Musical: Merrily We Roll Along
Kamau Wainaina // Rap Producer & Lyricist

Kamau Wainaina is a Kenyan artist and cereal connoisseur based in New York City. Specializing in the audiovisual, Kamau is intent on creating a world through a variety of different media that all can experience.  
Favorite Rap Album: Not Drowning but Waving by Loyle Carner
Favorite Podcast: Displaced by Vox Media
Favorite Musical: Les Miserables
Jasmine Elshamy // Writer

Jasmine is a senior at NYU who has spent the last few years in undergrad writing silly scripts and papers about how bad capitalism is. Aside from being a reality TV addict (a well-documented PumpHead), she loves a good musical, which is why she is so excited to be working on Childish!
Favorite Podcast: Las Culturistas, and she also loves Bad Bunny
Elyse Morales // Writer

Elyse Morales is a TV and film writer living in LA and trying her best. She is the producer of another Whale Bus show, Story Blocks. In her free time she rereads Lord of the Rings and hangs out with her roommate's cat.
Favorite Rap Song: "Dreams and Nightmares" by Meek Mill

Timeline
The episodes are written. The music is locked. We have an incredible cast. All that's left is to rehearse, record, and edit! We hope to finish recording in mid-May and release mid-summer!

We are so excited to have you along this journey with us. Check back on our Facebook and Twitter pages for updates on the production of Childish! 
What We Need & What You Get
We've made it this far, but we need your help to make it to the finish line. We still need funding to help us with the following: 


Music rights. Please help us in making sure we can pay to secure the rights to our music.

Food. We believe people have to eat. We are hungry artists (literally) who need the fuel to keep going!

Paying artists. We believe in paying artists for their hard work. Performers will receive a small stipend for their countless hours spent working. 

Make a contribution, and you can receive rewards of all kinds, from stickers to albums, to a producer credit on the project!
We need your help to bring this story to life. 
Thank you so much for your support. Please consider donating to this project, as well as sharing with your friends and family.

story:
Why does this Diner have Robots? Who are we?

We're two teens living, working, and studying in San Antonio; Mike and Eduardo. More than a podcast, we're a form of audible advocacy, for the worker, for the downtrodden, for the starving, huddled masses to which our country is supposed to be a shining beacon to the world.

When I say we, I'm referring to the small team of young, low-income, college-age men and women interested in affecting progressive change who make this podcast possible. We believe in the America of the future, one where poverty has been ameliorated and where we can live to our fullest potential. In this future - when we, the young people, are old and gray - can we meet again, maybe at a diner no longer serviced by humans, and look back on this moment knowing we fought for what was right? Or will we regret never pressing our leaders to work only for the people? Will we have become those very leaders? We look forward to that congregation, at that 'robot-diner,' where we can indeed smile on this moment. And we hope you'll join us there.

    We already have three guests lined up.

    1. Akhenaten Hotep Amun is running for the U.S. Senate in Georgia.
    2. Jensen Bohren is running for the U.S. Senate in Mississippi.
    3. Lorena Garcia is running for the U.S. Senate in Colorado.

    All three of these candidates have already agreed to be on our podcast. They may not be the front runners, and they may not make waves. But they each have a story to tell, and a vision for their respective states and for the future of this country. They deserve to be heard.

    The Diner needs your cash money.

    We would be truly grateful if you contributed. Here's what your money will go towards:

    • Two microphones - $240
    • One wind screen for the microphone - $30
    • One year business subscription on Squarespace - $216
    • Taxes & shipping - $14

    That's it, that's all we need. $500 in total to launch by October 2019.

    What comes next?

    We plan on having guests at all levels - for city council, county, parish, mayoral, judicial, and law enforcement candidates - for U.S. Senate, U.S. House, and President of the United States - for state representative, state senate, gubernatorial, and statewide offices - and even for special districts.

    How will we entice these guests to come on our show? The same as a snowball. If we can be entertaining enough and can attract enough lower-tier candidates, then we can begin to attract candidates of a higher and higher caliber, until we have the ear of candidates for the highest office in the land, just so that we can ask them if they will perpetuate the status-quo.

    What benefits will you receive?

    If you buy one of our two perks, we will add your name to the 'Founders' section on our website.

    We sincerely hope you will help us with our project. Thank you very much.

    Eduardo's Twitter & Instagram (@emtorresii)

    Mike's Twitter and Instagram (@mikecaballerotx)

    The Robot Diner Twitter & Instagram (@robotdiner)

The contributions will be helping us fund:

story:
The wonder of martial arts and combat sports is nothing if you can not experience it. While I am not getting younger it becomes increasingly difficult to invest into enough training in combat sports. This is an opportunity to experience a Martial Arts Journey by doing intensive training in MMA, to document and share my experience and discovery.

I will need finances to journey to Portland, USA - the famous SBG Portland gym  lead by Matt Thornton, where I will participate in the "Wimp 2 Warrior" program for 22 weeks, at which of the end I would engage in an amateur MMA fight.

The "Wimp 2 Warrior" program is designed to give an intensive MMA training experience to regular people to help them feel the transformation that mixed martial arts may offer. My plan is to fully participate in the program and document my journey.  I will also be collecting the best possible information about combat sports and martial arts, conducting interviews and more.

The finances are necessary to cover:
• Flight expenditures
• Daily expenditures
• Participation fees
For the whole six months.

I am also ready to offer any extra rewards for people who will support me. Just let me know what rewards you'd like, for example: extra videos, live google hangouts or anything else.

The program starts at October 6th and ends in March. I will need initial finances already by end of September to manage the trip.

This will be a life changing experience and I hope that with your support I will be able to share all of it with you.

story:
Radar Radio History

Radar Radio was formed in early 2015 and continued on through 2017. Here on Radar Radio, we interviewed many artists and offered 30 minute episodes per interview. The musicians we interviewed reached all forms of genres from pop, rock, hip-hop, jazz, country, and more. They came from all over the world through in-person and Skype interviews just for our show. Our goal was to showcase talented musicians who hadn't quite broken through to the mainstream field to have been played on the radio. I have always been incredibly passionate about finding people who are talented and who I believe the world needs to see and/or hear. With all the talent out there in the world, the radio really only covers what seems like about 15% of musical talent, up-and-coming or not. The music industry is definitely a hard industry to break through, and we wanted to help in whatever way we could to reach as many people as we could to help these up-and-comers gain some ground. We've had thousands of plays and hundreds of subscribers with just word of mouth and through social media advertising. 

So What Happened? 

In truth, a lack of financial support happened. This is a passion project and majority of the finances were coming from of my own pocket, and it costs more than you may think. If you're curious about what I mean, I'll explain more when I break down the costs below. It got to the point where I just couldn't afford funding Radar Radio on my own anymore. With working a full time job and also taking classes, there was little to no time left to work on and clean up the episodes and interviews, as they take hours to fix up for your listening pleasure. I personally wasn't able to put my all into making the podcast what I knew it could be, and that didn't feel right. I decided to put Radar Radio on a temporary and indefinite hiatus back in 2017. It's been about a year since the initial hiatus, and I've spent that time regrouping and figuring out where I want the podcast to pick up from here on out. I love Radar Radio with my whole heart, and I would love nothing more than to be able to continue it, showcasing even more talented people, musicians, and various artists. I am fully committed to getting Radar Radio back up and running, but I do need some help.

Where Do We Go From Here?

I want to bring Radar Radio back, and I'd like to bring it back better than ever. This includes brand new concepts, a new aesthetic, and even a new name (to be revealed at a later date). We are ready to come back better and stronger than before, and that also means we would be moving on from just musicians. There are so many brilliant forms of art out there, why should we limit ourselves only to music? We're talking all forms of entertainment: musicians, actors, writers, directors, artists, animators, and so much more. I believe we can absolutely accomplish this ambitious vision by bringing in new additions to our creative team. Don't worry, friends, everything may be changing, but the core of Radar Radio still remains: We are passionate about passionate artists and we just want to share their passions with you. 

The Perks

As of right now, we really can't offer you very much. What we can offer is our greatest thanks to you for listing your name on our website as a supporter of Radar Radio, and we pledge to you our undying gratitude. 

The Breakdown of Costs

In truth, this kind of thing probably costs more than people think. There are a lot of finances that do add up over time. While we do conduct interviews over Skype due to location on occasion, we try to do most interviews in person, and the cost of travel adds up very quickly (you'll understand especially if you know how long it takes to get around in LA). There are pricey editing programs we use to trim our episodes and clean up the quality of the audio, leasing fees in order to have enough bandwidth on the websites we use to conveniently hold all the episodes in one place, and so much more. I also do not take any sort of personal revenue and neither does my (amazing) team. 

Conclusion

Thank you for taking the time to hear us out, take us into consideration, and for possibly giving us a small donation. I appreciate all of you more than you could know. And, if you aren't able help by donating, liking our Facebook page would definitely help. Thanks to all of you again, and please share this post to get the word out! We hope to see you soon!

story:
The HHH Threat (Patent Pending (Maybe not really))

We are a third party podcast that reviews quidditch, beer, and wrestling. That's right, we cover three markets in one podcast, who else can do that? Nobody, thought so. Anyway, we are looking to bring our unique brand of journalism and entertainment to the Quidditch Cup 11. You'll get to meet in person (whether that's a good thing or not is up to you), and maybe have a beer* with us.
​

What we aim to provide:

  • Recording of game footage
  • Recording of the QC11 experience
  • Interviews with players
  • Interviews with teams
  • Live podcasting and updates 
  • Day 1 podcast overview
  • And other fun shenanigans

What donations will pay for

Donations made will help us poor boys make our way out to QC11. Here is a list:

  • Rental car
  • Gas
  • Housing
  • Our pretty faces (but just Eric's really)

 

*= Applicable to persons 21 years and older. Don't goof us please.

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Henry Charles Darnell I crossed the stage at PVAMU, survived sepsis, & i'm over HENDOG MEDIA+DESIGN.
  • This podcast is important because more stories should be heard.
  • With this funding it would help get the ball rolling on season 3 & tell more stories. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • The goal of $1500 will go to improving the podcast like new equipment &  covering some costs.
  • for the perks the they will be thank you postcards, stickers. and passwords to download season 3.
  • Even if we don't reach the goal the money will go toward the podcast.

The Impact

  • This project is valuable to the world & stories are truly important.
  • To this point we did 10 episodes & 2 seasons so we're fully capable.

Risks & Challenges

The challenges that come with this are straight forward.

  • Right now because of my voice I can't host like I want but I can adapt by using siri or another person to help me out.
  • Even though there are challenges to doing this I refuse to quit.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and spread the word.
  • Don't be afraid to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
“For me, this audio revival of Dan Dare is a triumph. Each of the three episodes have the feel of an audio movie and it is easy to get pulled into their world. I cannot wait for the Anastasia to get back out there and explore this universe, and gladly give it square-jawed, generation gap busting 10/10.” - Ian McArdell, IndieMacUser

In 2017 icon of British science fiction, DAN DARE, dramatically returned to the airwaves over six all-new audio adventures featuring acclaimed performances from Ed Stoppard (Dan Dare), Geoff McGivern (Digby), Heida Reed (Professor Peabody), Michael Cochrane (Sir Hurbert) and Raad Rawi (The Mekon) along with many notable guest stars including Hugh Fraser, Noof McEwan, Bijan Daneshmand and Jonathan Rhodes.

Inspired by the original Eagle comic strip (1950-1967), B7 Media’s audio reboot of comic-book space hero DAN DARE was hailed by fans and critics alike - and the first season was also nominated for several radio awards. Most notably Vol 2 won the prestigious NYC International Radio Program Gold Award for ‘Best Digital Drama’ (2018).

We’re very proud of what we accomplished; the fulfilment of a 25-year old ambition of producer/director Andrew Mark Sewell. Over the last 18-months we've also been delighted to receive many, many requests for further adventures - which is why we've launched this crowdfunding campaign.

We want DAN DARE’s audio adventure to continue but we also need your support to fund production of a new, action-packed season of stories once again pitting Dan Dare and his crew against the Mekon - and other menaces, too!

"This is a slick, streamlined trilogy of stories that takes one of the all-time greats, puts him in a newly kitted out and streamlined world and lets him and his colleagues soar." 

-  Sci-Fi Bulletin

“Feeling very much in the same cliffhanging style as pulp SF sagas like Flash Gordon, these are pacy, action-packed adventures that aren’t afraid to throw more modern concepts and references into Dare’s world.” - SFX Magazine

“It’s all very mysterious and intriguing, which are two of the things good science-fiction should be. The writers are taking the strengths of the original stories and shaping something new and exciting and that can only be a good thing. The best of the old and the best of the new, brought together seamlessly.” - DowntheTubes.net

"Ed Stoppard’s Dan Dare and Geoff McGivern’s Digby and their fractious relationship that evolves from one of cold distrust to mutual appreciation would have stolen the show if it wasn’t for Raad Rawi’s planet chewing turn as the narcissistic and megalomaniacal Mekon. Because, and much as we’re loathe to admit it, everyone loves a villain and Rawi’s Mekon is the epitome of self-serving, cold, logical evil. Welcome back Colonel Dare…" - Mass Movement

“For me, this audio revival of Dan Dare is a triumph. Each of the three episodes have the feel of an audio movie and it is easy to get pulled into their world. I cannot wait for the Anastasia to get back out there and explore this universe, and gladly give it square-jawed, generation gap busting 10/10.” - Ian McArdall, IndieMacUser

Our writers, cast and production team have more exciting Dan Dare stories to tell – the storylines have already been scripted for a new trilogy of stories (the first being ‘All Treens Must Die’.) 2020 makes the 70th anniversary of the ‘Pilot of the Future’ so releasing Vol 3, a new season of three exciting stories, would be a fitting tribute to complete the Dan Dare story arc we set in motion with Season 1.

Our initial plan is to fund and produce the first episode (see below) and release it digitally. If there's sufficient demand and interest, we will go onto crowdfund subsequent episodes and as the stakes increase, so will the perks!

Our ultimate goal is to fund the development, scripting, production and post-production of Vol Three in its entirety, boasting 3 x 75-minute adventures. The total budget for this is £45,000. Reaching further goals will allow us to commission scripts for Volume Four, commission more episodes and produce a special drama revealing the astonishing ‘true’ story behind the creation of Dan Dare by Frank Hampson and the Reverend Marcus Morris.

 

Each story is inspired by the original comic-strip first published in the Eagle Comic. 

The stories that make up Volume 3 will be;

ALL TREENS MUST DIE written by Colin Brake

Dan Dare has finally captured his arch-enemy and brought The Mekon to Earth to face trial for crimes against humanity. Despite Dare’s victory, however, these are troubled times on Earth. In the Reconstruction after the devastating invasion told in the first season adventure "Reign of the Robots", most menial tasks are now undertaken by refugee alien Treens. Many humans are hostile to and resentful of these aliens “taking their jobs”. Discontent is rumbling and, although defeated, the Mekon has a plan. When Treens loyal to the Mekon break him free, Dare and his team (Digby and Professor Peabody) are forced back into action to save not one world, but two as the Mekon’s twisted ideology of racial purity leads him to attack his own people, declaring, “All Treens Must Die...”

OPERATION DARK STAR written by Colin Brake

Dan Dare and Digby join Dare’s Uncle Ivor, on a mission to follow the route taken by Dare’s missing father, Frank Dare, in the ill-fated Orion Orbiter. Their destination - the Dark Star hidden near Pluto, which guards a stable Einstein-Rosen bridge: a wormhole through space/time. Meanwhile, Peabody, tasked by Sir Hubert of Space Fleet to investigate Eagle Corp, discovers evidence of secret off-the-books research being carried out by their old enemy, the mad scientist Blasco, using the Dark Star station as his base of operations. But before Peabody can warn Dare of the danger, Ivor – still struggling to find his own identity in the shadow of his famous brother – betrays his nephew to join Blasco’s cause. With all apparently lost, only Peabody can save Dare but she has her own, much more personal, crisis to deal with...

TERRA NOVA written by Colin Brake

Travelling through the time distortions of the Dark Star wormhole, Dare and his friends are joined by an unexpected stowaway - Cadet “Flamer” Spry. They reach Terra Nova (the alien planet Dare’s father found years ago) now the last planet holding out against the Vora’s apparently unstoppable advance across the known universe. It’s been completely ravaged by war and the Vora is about to launch a final assault. Learning that his father is being held a prisoner by the Vora, Dare attempts a rescue but ends up captured and thrown in a cell along with another prisoner: a defeated and despondent Mekon. Dare has to persuade his former enemy that together they can escape and defeat the Vora once and for all. But with the Vora’s mighty battle fleet already advancing towards the wormhole to attack Earth, will Dare and the Mekon’s desperate union succeed? Or will this prove to be Dan Dare’s final adventure?

We need to pay for the writers, actors, staff, studio hire, post-production, music, graphic designers, CD manufacture and of course Brian Williamson’s superb promotional artwork.

Each feature-length episode of Dan Dare costs approximately £14,500 to produce – that’s just over half the budget it would normally take to produce an equivalent one-hour audio drama for BBC Radio 4.

The bottom line is that we need your support to ensure Dan Dare’s return to the airwaves isn’t short lived and we get to celebrate his milestone 70th anniversary in style.

We’d love to conclude the trilogy of Dan Dare stories, bringing Dare’s conflict with his arch nemesis The Mekon to an exciting and shocking conclusion.

But your support is critical to making this happen!

Pledging money to this campaign is the only way you can access our rewards. Our initial rewards will get us going with Episode One, "All Treens Must Die", but we have plenty of big ideas for what we can add to our stretch goals and future plans!

For example, future stretch goal rewards may include posters of artwork, signed scripts from our back catalogue and the new series scripts, further downloads including music from the series, T-shirts, limited edition prints and more.

The campaign for "All Treens Must Die"  currently includes:

Desktop artwork, a "thank you" credit on the Dan Dare webpage, outtakes from the episode's production, downloads of scripts from the previous volumes, a limited edition enamel pin of the Anastasia based on Brian Williamson's artwork and the chance for a character to carry your name!

And if we succeed in raising the money for Episode 1... It's onwards to Episodes 2 and 3 - and then we're really pushing the boat out!

  • On completion of the trilogy, an exclusive Limited Edition 70th Anniversary copy of the Dan Dare audio series in full. These limited edition packages will not be made available in shops or online stores so will be a ‘must have’ for any Dan Dare aficionado.
  • Tickets to our invitation-only cast and crew launch event in Soho, London.
  • Brian Williamson has drawn some stunning new artwork to celebrate the 70th anniversary of Dan Dare, which we’ll  print up as classic sized movie posters and if you asked nicely, he’ll even personally sign them!

Although any production can encounter logistical challenges and delays, we hope to fulfil all rewards by the end of the year (2020). With a release date already set for the Autumn 2020, we'll be working hard to ensure that you'll have your rewards in time for Christmas 2020.

If you have any questions about the rewards, additions, or changes, then please message us during the campaign. We're here and we're listening!

 

At B7 Media we’re known for our love of the science fiction genre and our particular brand of Audio Movies. We’ve dramatised for audio everything from the cult BBC sci-fi series Blake’s 7 (BBC Radio 4 Extra) to Isaac Asimov's I, Robot and Ray Bradbury’s The Martian Chronicles (BBC Radio 4) to the acclaimed docudrama The Space Race (Audible Originals).

Since our childhood, we have loved Dan Dare. We grew up with him and watched as he evolved. The original was already in the British consciousness before we were born.

Our approach to this new audio incarnation has been to give the listener a modern Dan Dare in a classic form, adopting the fast-moving serialised format that echoes how the space hero was first brought to life for the radio by Radio Luxembourg, back in the 1950s. That format, as well as allowing for nail-biting cliffhangers, is also an epic and vibrant modern-day homage to the action heroes of 1930s adventure serials such as Flash Gordon and Buck Rogers– but with all the sophisticated production values, which have become our company’s hallmark.

Our Dan Dare is played for real (in its own 1950s terms), and exciting. It very much reflects how the original comic strips worked. After all, Frank Hampson created a world you could step into, not just a cartoon… Spaceship Away!

 

ED STOPPARD is Colonel Dan Dare

Ed Stoppard is perhaps best known for his film roles in The Pianist, Joy Division, Brideshead Revisited and Youth, starring Michael Caine and Hervey Keitel. He also played the banking mogul Rob in British independent feature film Papadopoulos & Sons.

Television roles include Sir Hallam Holland in the BBC sequel to Upstairs, Downstairs; the Channel Four mini-series adaptation of William Boyd's critically acclaimed novel Any Human Heart, The Frankenstein Chronicles and Cilla, starring Sheridan Smith. Most recently Ed starred as Dr Will Campbell in ITV's hit drama series Home Fires (following a group of inspirational women in a rural Cheshire community during World War II) and is King Philip in History’s drama Knightfall.

GEOFF MCGIVERN is Lieutenant Digby

Geoff McGivern is probably best known to science fiction fans as the original Ford Prefect in The Hitch Hikers Guide to the Galaxy on Radio since 1978 and the recent Live UK tours. His recent TV work includes three different roles in Toast of London, Esio Trot with Dustin Hoffman, Matt Le Blanc's business manager in Episodes, marrying June Whitfield in Boomers, Plebs, and the Archdeacon in Grantchester. He will shortly be seen in Disney teen musical, The Lodge, Upstart Crow with David Mitchell and a sitcom pilot with Mitchell and Webb called Back for Channel 4.

HEIDA REED is Professor Jocelyn Peabody

Heida Reed is an Icelandic actress best known for playing Ross Poldark’s first love, Elizabeth, in the popular BBC drama Poldark. Her other credits include series regular Adele in Fox’s Jo, which starred Jean Reno in his first TV Lead, and appearing alongside Anne Hathaway and Jim Sturgess in One Day. Heida was wonderful at Southwark Playhouse in Scarlet (playing Scarlet).

MICHAEL COCHRANE is Sir Hubert Guest

Michael Cochrane has appeared in numerous series, serials, plays, sitcoms and drama-documentaries on both television and radio. His TV appearances have included Wings, Criminal Justice, Law and Order and as Sir Henry Simmerson in the period drama series Sharpe. His film career has included roles in Escape to Victory, The Return of the Soldier, Number One Gun, The Saint, Incognito, A Different Loyalty and The Iron Lady.

His numerous genre credits include having twice appeared in Doctor Who, first as Charles Cranleigh in the serial Black Orchid (1982) and later as Redvers Fenn-Cooper in Ghost Light (1989). He was featured in the ITV science fiction series The Uninvited. He has also appeared in numerous audio dramas from Big Finish and most notably can be heard in Nicholas Briggs’ acclaimed audio reboot of The Prisoner starring Mark Elstob.

RAAD RAWI is The Mekon

Raad Rawi is perhaps best known for roles in Spy (2015), The Devil's Double (2011) and Traitor (2008). He will be known to many for his appearance in some of the most popular British television drama series including; Coronation Street, The Bill, Silent Witness, Holby City, Murphy's Law, Dalziel and Pascoe, Judge John Deed, Cadfael, Mona Lisa, Midnight Express, Bugs, Bergerac, Boon, Bust, Crown Court, Play for Today, Spooks and The Tudors. Most recently he appeared as General Tariq in 2 seasons of US hit series Tyrant.

We’ve amassed an award-winning production team to help Dan Dare defeat the Mekon’s invasion plans for Earth;

ANDREW MARK SEWELL - Director

Andrew Mark Sewell is a former senior BBC executive and now multi award-winning independent filmmaker and radio drama producer/director for BBC Radio and Audible. Winner of the prestigious NYC International Radio Program ‘Best Director’ Award for Isaac Asimov’s I, Robot (BBC Radio 4) and nominated as ‘Best Drama Producer’ at the Audio Production Awards (2015 & 2017), Sewell’s name has become synonymous with some of the best science audio and audio drama produced in the last decade.

Best known for the re-imagining of comic-strip space hero Dan Dare and cult BBC television series Blake’s 7, most recently for Audible Originals he was the Series Producer of the major docudrama series about the history of The Space Race. Other notable credits include Ghostwatch Live (credited as the first live paranormal investigation on television), Echoes of the Past, Tomorrow’s World+, Sonnet 155 (for Almeida Theatre) and acclaimed indie feature films Mrs. Palfrey at the Claremont and Exit Thread.

HELEN QUIGLEY - Producer

Helen Quigley has nearly twenty years’ experience in producing audio for broadcast. As a producer, her work includes network radio trails for the BBC’s flagship TV programming, including Poldark, Line of Duty, Dracula, The Apprentice and Blue Planet II. Her audio drama credits include Eleanor of Aquitaine: Mother of the Pride and The Space Race. Previously she was a Continuity Announcer and Producer for Comedy Central UK, working with up-and-coming comedians who are now far too famous to call her anymore. She also launched Robin Ince and Josie Long on their first forays into podcasting as Producer of Robin Ince’s Show and Tell and Utter Shambles.

COLIN BRAKE – Series Script Editor / Writer

Coin Brake is a Writers’ Guild-nominated scriptwriter and Sunday Times best-selling author with 30 years of experience. Colin worked on the hit BBC soap EastEnders as both a Story Editor and Storyline Editor. As a writer he was a contributor to each season of the 90s Carnival Films/BBC Saturday night adventure series BUGS and also served as the Script Executive for the show. He has written numerous television scripts including EastEnders, Crossroads, Lucy Sullivan is Getting Married, Byker Grove and more than 30 episodes of the BBC Daytime soap, Doctors. He has also written several Doctor Who and Jago & Litefoot audio dramas for Big Finish.

RICHARD KURTI & BEV DOYLE – Lead Writers

Lead writers Richard Kurti and Bev Doyle are audio credits include B7 Media’s modern reinvention of Ray Bradbury’s The Martian Chronicles; Isaac Asimov’s I, Robot; Frank Hampson‘s Dan Dare, Rudyard Kipling’s The Jungle Book and a new musical production of Jeff Wayne’s War of the Worlds. Their highly regarded work for film and television includes their own BBC ONE miniseries The Baker Street Irregulars and Terry Pratchett's Going Postal (Sky 1).

Their shows have earned numerous awards and nominations, including: three BAFTA nominations, two Royal Television Society Awards and two RTS nominations for Going Postal; nomination for Outstanding Motion Picture Made for TV at the US Satellite Awards for Kidnapped; nomination for Best TV Series Drama at the Satellite Awards for Primeval, and four BAFTA nominations for Wolfblood.

JOHN FREEMAN – Creative Consultant

Magazine editor and comics writer John Freeman's developed the new setting for our Dan Dare adventures, expanded on by our writing team. His credits include being editor of Doctor Who Magazine, Star Trek Magazine, Babylon 5 Magazine and numerous comics anthologies including Marvel UK’s Overkill in the 1990s and most recently, STRIP Magazine. He has written several audio comic scripts for ROK Comics including Team M.O.B.I.L.E. and edited the British comics news site www.downthetubes.net since 1999.

There are always risks and challenges when making any production, no less so when making audio drama. From actors suddenly becoming unavailable, to agents demanding a different colour spaceship for their star client.

However, the B7 Media team has extensive production experience across television, radio and film. We will deliver this production with the utmost skill and efficiency. 

You can be rest assured that we'll do everything in our power to produce an exciting new audio continuation to the original Dan Dare comic-strip adventures, but also hopefully introduce this perennial British hero to an entirely new audience.

A few members of our crew are very busy, and so their availability may be an issue depending on timing. They've all very kindly agreed to do their best to fit this project in if they are busy on other projects, but if they are unavailable they will be replaced by another, equally skilled and talented industry professional. As such our cast and crew are correct at the time of publication, but may change.

We will do our best to avoid delays though, as is often the nature of working in this genre, battling with the Mekon can make some delays unavoidable.

WITH YOUR HELP, THE CONTINUING ADVENTURES OF DAN DARE WILL BE ASSURED – Spaceship Away!

And if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help. Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign and use the Indiegogo share tools.

Dan Dare: The Audio Adventures are based on the original Eagle Comic Strip created by Frank Hampson and Reverend Marcus Morris.

Dan Dare: The Audio Adventures © B7 Productions Ltd 2019. All rights reserved.

Dan Dare wordmark and logo are trademarks of Dan Dare Corporation Ltd and are used under license. Dan Dare ™ © Dan Dare Corporation Ltd 2019. All rights reserved.

Her other credits include series regular Adele in Fox’s Jo, which starred Jean Reno in his first TV Lead, and appearing alongside Anne Hathaway and Jim Sturgess in One Day. Heida was wonderful at Southwark Playhouse in Scarlet (playing Scarlet).
MICHAEL COCHRANE is Sir Hubert Guest

Michael Cochrane has appeared in numerous series, serials, plays, sitcoms and drama-documentaries on both television and radio. His TV appearances have included Wings, Criminal Justice, Law and Order and as Sir Henry Simmerson in the period drama series Sharpe. His film career has included roles in Escape to Victory, The Return of the Soldier, Number One Gun, The Saint, Incognito, A Different Loyalty and The Iron Lady.
His numerous genre credits include having twice appeared in Doctor Who, first as Charles Cranleigh in the serial Black Orchid (1982) and later as Redvers Fenn-Cooper in Ghost Light (1989). He was featured in the ITV science fiction series The Uninvited. He has also appeared in numerous audio dramas from Big Finish and most notably can be heard in Nicholas Briggs’ acclaimed audio reboot of The Prisoner starring Mark Elstob.
RAAD RAWI is The Mekon
Raad Rawi is perhaps best known for roles in Spy (2015), The Devil's Double (2011) and Traitor (2008). He will be known to many for his appearance in some of the most popular British television drama series including; Coronation Street, The Bill, Silent Witness, Holby City, Murphy's Law, Dalziel and Pascoe, Judge John Deed, Cadfael, Mona Lisa, Midnight Express, Bugs, Bergerac, Boon, Bust, Crown Court, Play for Today, Spooks and The Tudors. Most recently he appeared as General Tariq in 2 seasons of US hit series Tyrant.

We’ve amassed an award-winning production team to help Dan Dare defeat the Mekon’s invasion plans for Earth;
ANDREW MARK SEWELL - Director
Andrew Mark Sewell is a former senior BBC executive and now multi award-winning independent filmmaker and radio drama producer/director for BBC Radio and Audible. Winner of the prestigious NYC International Radio Program ‘Best Director’ Award for Isaac Asimov’s I, Robot (BBC Radio 4) and nominated as ‘Best Drama Producer’ at the Audio Production Awards (2015 & 2017), Sewell’s name has become synonymous with some of the best science audio and audio drama produced in the last decade.
Best known for the re-imagining of comic-strip space hero Dan Dare and cult BBC television series Blake’s 7, most recently for Audible Originals he was the Series Producer of the major docudrama series about the history of The Space Race. Other notable credits include Ghostwatch Live (credited as the first live paranormal investigation on television), Echoes of the Past, Tomorrow’s World+, Sonnet 155 (for Almeida Theatre) and acclaimed indie feature films Mrs. Palfrey at the Claremont and Exit Thread.
HELEN QUIGLEY - Producer
Helen Quigley has nearly twenty years’ experience in producing audio for broadcast. As a producer, her work includes network radio trails for the BBC’s flagship TV programming, including Poldark, Line of Duty, Dracula, The Apprentice and Blue Planet II. Her audio drama credits include Eleanor of Aquitaine: Mother of the Pride and The Space Race. Previously she was a Continuity Announcer and Producer for Comedy Central UK, working with up-and-coming comedians who are now far too famous to call her anymore. She also launched Robin Ince and Josie Long on their first forays into podcasting as Producer of Robin Ince’s Show and Tell and Utter Shambles.
COLIN BRAKE – Series Script Editor / Writer
Coin Brake is a Writers’ Guild-nominated scriptwriter and Sunday Times best-selling author with 30 years of experience. Colin worked on the hit BBC soap EastEnders as both a Story Editor and Storyline Editor. As a writer he was a contributor to each season of the 90s Carnival Films/BBC Saturday night adventure series BUGS and also served as the Script Executive for the show. He has written numerous television scripts including EastEnders, Crossroads, Lucy Sullivan is Getting Married, Byker Grove and more than 30 episodes of the BBC Daytime soap, Doctors. He has also written several Doctor Who and Jago & Litefoot audio dramas for Big Finish.
RICHARD KURTI & BEV DOYLE – Lead Writers
Lead writers Richard Kurti and Bev Doyle are audio credits include B7 Media’s modern reinvention of Ray Bradbury’s The Martian Chronicles; Isaac Asimov’s I, Robot; Frank Hampson‘s Dan Dare, Rudyard Kipling’s The Jungle Book and a new musical production of Jeff Wayne’s War of the Worlds. Their highly regarded work for film and television includes their own BBC ONE miniseries The Baker Street Irregulars and Terry Pratchett's Going Postal (Sky 1).
Their shows have earned numerous awards and nominations, including: three BAFTA nominations, two Royal Television Society Awards and two RTS nominations for Going Postal; nomination for Outstanding Motion Picture Made for TV at the US Satellite Awards for Kidnapped; nomination for Best TV Series Drama at the Satellite Awards for Primeval, and four BAFTA nominations for Wolfblood.
JOHN FREEMAN – Creative Consultant
Magazine editor and comics writer John Freeman's developed the new setting for our Dan Dare adventures, expanded on by our writing team. His credits include being editor of Doctor Who Magazine, Star Trek Magazine, Babylon 5 Magazine and numerous comics anthologies including Marvel UK’s Overkill in the 1990s and most recently, STRIP Magazine. He has written several audio comic scripts for ROK Comics including Team M.O.B.I.L.E. and edited the British comics news site www.downthetubes.net since 1999.


There are always risks and challenges when making any production, no less so when making audio drama. From actors suddenly becoming unavailable, to agents demanding a different colour spaceship for their star client.
However, the B7 Media team has extensive production experience across television, radio and film. We will deliver this production with the utmost skill and efficiency. 
You can be rest assured that we'll do everything in our power to produce an exciting new audio continuation to the original Dan Dare comic-strip adventures, but also hopefully introduce this perennial British hero to an entirely new audience.
A few members of our crew are very busy, and so their availability may be an issue depending on timing. They've all very kindly agreed to do their best to fit this project in if they are busy on other projects, but if they are unavailable they will be replaced by another, equally skilled and talented industry professional. As such our cast and crew are correct at the time of publication, but may change.
We will do our best to avoid delays though, as is often the nature of working in this genre, battling with the Mekon can make some delays unavoidable.
WITH YOUR HELP, THE CONTINUING ADVENTURES OF DAN DARE WILL BE ASSURED – Spaceship Away!


And if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help. Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign and use the Indiegogo share tools.
Dan Dare: The Audio Adventures are based on the original Eagle Comic Strip created by Frank Hampson and Reverend Marcus Morris.
Dan Dare: The Audio Adventures © B7 Productions Ltd 2019. All rights reserved.
Dan Dare wordmark and logo are trademarks of Dan Dare Corporation Ltd and are used under license. Dan Dare ™ © Dan Dare Corporation Ltd 2019. All rights reserved.

story:
The Mission and Goal

It is the mission of Appeal 5 LLC (Racing Refresh) to create quality content to our customers through the use of innovation and entertainment. 

  • Racing Refresh creates weekly motorsports content via our online news website and our weekly radio-style online podcast.
  • Our hosts compete in amateur racing through a long-time partnership with TigerPaw Racing team out of the Columbus Ohio market. 
  • On June 19th, it is our goal to enter into our first semi-professional motorsports event, a 50 lap late-model truck race in the CRS Truck Series.

What We Need & What You Get

Motorsports can be pricy! We are offering rewards and recognitions for our friends, families, and business partners that are able to help fund this campaign.

  • Our team seeks $8,000 as a goal to compete in the truck racing event. These funds will contribute to sponsoring the ride, all travel expenses, insurance expenses, and create additional funds for future events in the 2021 season.  Any additional funding greater than our goal will be used to fund our radio program for the rest of the year and beyond.
  • We will be offering different perks based on contribution amount as our thank you from the team.
  • Every dollar helps us make it into this event. In addition to personal recognitions, we will promote any company or small business that backs this campaign in various ways. 

The Impact

Without funding, motorsports teams worldwide fail. At the end of every show co-host Tyler Lawler asks you to consider supporting your local short tracks. Our entry will attract new fans to Shadybowl Speedway in De Graff, Ohio and help us promote the CRS racing circuit on a new digital platform via our Racing Refresh outlet.

Risks & Challenges

Racing Refresh is limited in funding for our program as many businesses and charities are during these tough financial times. We value your time and money, and offer our most sincere appreciation for whatever you are able to give. Indiegogo is a proven crowdfunding site that has helped thousands of teams reach their goals. Donations are safe and will be paid directly to the creative teams behind the fundraiser...in this case, Racing Refresh and TigerPaw Racing. If full funding is not fully met for this event, funds will still be used to help grow our podcast and fund the 2021 season. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Unable to contribute at this time? Did you know that sharing a link can often times equate to nearly double contributions?! Please help share our page, allowing us to reach a new level within our brand. We are committed to entertaining our audience for years to come.

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Gavin Gaddis, and I miss Halloween. In a time of heatwaves and pineapple-flavored everything, let us cast our minds forward to much more chilling times. I’ve been a podcast producer for two years now and want to take that experience to create a limited run fiction podcast that fully embraces the Halloween season, mixing scares and laughs along the way.  

A 4 minute trailer for The Ghost in 3B is now live on our podcast feed!

Why? I love Halloween dearly and The Ghost in 3B aims to be an atonement for past sins. A hefty work schedule in 2018 kept me so out of focus that by the time I was ready to watch some cheesy slasher flicks it was October 30th and I had nary a costume nor haunted house visit to show for it. Truly dark times. 

 

This year, I plan to be ready. With a 75-ish page script, five frighteningly talented voice actors, and a heck of a lot of sound design I aim to deliver a horror podcast that gets the listener properly in the mood for Halloween. A story of a ghostly tenant’s unstoppable terror colliding with the immovable force of an impossible-to-scare new roommate. Hijinks ensue. 

 

My bona fides include producing the IGG-funded hopepunk sci-fi podcast Standard Docking Procedure and co-hosting the podcast about podcasting Tuned In, Dialed Up with fellow journalist Wil Williams. What free time I have from my day job is poured into either writing about podcasts or making them myself. I’ve also been a lifelong horror fan and still have some Halloween decorations up from last year. Missing out on ‘Ween 2018 legitimately has haunted me and I’m raring to set things right this year.

 

What We Need & What You Get

As is crowdfunding tradition I’ve broken everything down into a delicious pie chart to explore the costs that go into producing audio fiction.

As our pie friend demonstrates, the (spooky) lion’s share goes to supporting the amazing voice actors that will bring life to this story. Beyond that a little bit to cover the shipping costs of merch for the campaign and a modest Wordpress website to give the podcast a home. 

In return for your support, you’ll get early access to the entire miniseries the first week of October! While everyone else is waiting on the edge of their seat you can be curled up in your favorite cobweb-filled dark corner with headphones on your ears and Halloween in your heart. 

In addition, there are a handful of cool physical Halloween-y goodies you can get your hands on! At $5 you get in-canon items from Dawn Springs sent to your mailbox, pilfered straight from the files of Robert Nadal’s investigations into the apartment’s haunting. 

$25 joins the Spook-Tember Club, in which I harness my six years of being a media critic to craft weekly lists of movies, television shows, music, and video games sent right to your e-mail inbox to get you properly prepared to really enjoy October right. This will culminate with a big-ole virtual sleepover on Tuesday, October 1st where we’ll all gather ‘round our monitors and have a heck of a watch party to celebrate the arrival of October and The Ghost in 3B!

In the event we don’t reach our final goal, 100% of the raised funds will be divided amongst the voice actors. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge I foresee with this project is our hard deadline of the first week of October with a week of August entirely shot while I’m covering Podcast Movement in Orlando. That said, I feel we have a comfortable amount of run-up time in September to get the series polished and ready for distribution. 

 

The feed for the show exists, I already have the workflow for fiction podcasting set up due to Standard Docking Procedure, and casting has already been taken care of. The main hurdle is finishing up the scripts and paying voice actors. From then on it’s editing and sound design work straight to the finish line.

That said the biggest risk, of course, getting too spooked.

Other Ways You Can Help

Know some people who like horror? Send them the trailer to the show! Word of mouth is the biggest boon for podcasts. Share this campaign on social media! Every little bit helps and is dearly appreciated.
