story:
Who Are We? 

Oh, The Fool is currently comprised of four passionate artists who have banded together to create a company which will produce the new podcast series "Life in Sonderville." 

 Mark Swift is the founder of Oh, The Fool and the creator of "Life in Sonderville." Working as an actor and writer, Mark Swift decided the next step in his adventure in the world of arts would be to take on the challenge of starting an independent company that would produce content online and eventually onstage.

 Abby Anderson is the Head Editor at Oh, The Fool and plays the role of Dr. Erin Barrett in "Life in Sonderville." As an actor and full-time theatre person, Abby Anderson brings her talents to Oh, The Fool in the hopes of watching the company grow into something truly spectacular.  

Alec Grosso is the Head Illustrator at Oh, The Fool. You can find his designs and illustrations all over official Oh, The Fool merchandise as well the promotional art for "Life in Sonderville" (Coming Soon!). Alec works as a freelance illustrator/animator and dreams of one day creating his very own cartoon. Check out more of Alec's work here.

Aj Mostrangeli is the Head Sound Designer at Oh, The Fool and plays the parts of the Maddock Brothers in "Life in Sonderville." Aj is a passionate musician whose original pieces can be heard throughout "Life In Sonderville."

Justin Giachetti is the head Sound Engineer at Oh, The Fool. Justin is an all around theatre lover and artist. When he's not working on Life In Sonderville, he is busy running his very own theatre company, Breaking Through The Box.

What Is Our Mission?

Oh, The Fool seeks to explore the world of interactive, personalized storytelling. Onstage and online, you will be able to experience brand new and original stories in a unique and fresh way. Our first project that is currently in production is "Life In Sonderville."

What Is LIFE IN SONDERVILLE?

"Sonderville; a community of circumstance. Housing a nearly insignificant population of one hundred and fifty residents, Sonderville is an enigmatic suburb cloistered deep within the Auberdine Forest, with nothing but a single-track rail system tenuously tying it to proper civilization. Despite its reclusiveness and inconsequential population, Sonderville finds itself teeming with people as a popular, if not controversial tourist attraction." 

"Life in Sonderville" is a choose your own adventure style podcast series that is currently in production. Episodes will be broken down into chapters, some chapters will contain more episodes than others, as is the nature of choose your own adventure. Most listeners' experiences with the story will vary greatly. Depending on the choices made a story can last anywhere from seven to ten chapters. The goal here is to balance a satisfying story line for any one time listener and a fully realized world with intertwining mysteries for the more adventurous types who will brave all ninety seven possible episodes. It is a difficult task but we here at Oh, The Fool feel up to the challenge. 

Where Will The Funding Go?

When "Life in Sonderville" is produced, it will be free to listen to through several media- we have our sights set towards SoundCloud and Youtube to start. 

However, and most importantly; Oh, The Fool operates under the philosophy that artists of all kinds should be compensated fairly for their hard work. "Life in Sonderville" will feature dozens of characters and rich soundscapes to truly capture the essence of this mysterious American suburb. In order to produce a truly magnificent adventure, we will need the help of talented and passionate artists (not limited to those listed above) to fulfill these tasks and Oh, The Fool wants nothing more than to make sure that those who put their heart and soul into the project are rewarded for their efforts. 

Rewards

If you've read through the reward tiers then you may have an idea of what is coming your way. Here is further clarification.

Discord: For those who may be unfamiliar, Discord is a free-to-download chat server app for many communities. Oh, The Fool will be making a Discord channel which backers of all tiers will be granted access to. On the Discord channel you can chat with other backers and various members of the Oh, The Fool staff in typical forum fashion. 

Oh, The Fool Thank You Tarot Card: This fun little card, designed by Alec Grosso, is the calling card of Oh, The Fool. This is will be mailed to your address with a personalized thank you written by founder, Mark Swift. 

Early Story Access: If you are a particularly generous backer then you will receive access to each and every "Life in Sonderville" chapter two full days before their public releases.

One/Three Card Tarot Reading: Oh, The Fool founder, Mark Swift is a student of tarot and has been actively practicing tarot for several years. Once you donate to either the third or fourth tier you will receive a one or three card tarot card reading based on an inquiry of your choice. Your tarot card reading will be presented to you via a video recording, with an outline of your results sent to your desired email address for archival if you so desire. 

Signed Oh, The Fool Tarot Card Poster/Signed Life in Sonderville Poster: At the second to final tier you will get a choice one of two 18x24 posters. At the Final tier you get both!

 Ten Card Tarot Reading: One of the two rewards exclusive to the final tier is the ten card reading. This reading is more heavily involved then the previous two and will be done via a live video chat so you can enjoy a more personalized experience. 

On The Horizon

While "Life in Sonderville" is Oh, The Fool's primary project, we realize that backers want to feel like their donation is an investment. We at Oh, The Fool have grand ambitions beyond "Life in Sonderville;" please take a look below.

Project: Fate: This incredibly ambitious project is one that takes personalized storytelling to the next level. Taking inspiration from Dungeons and Dragons, Tarot, and H.P. Lovecraft's Cthulhu mythos, Project: Fate will have subscribers (and top tier donors) create a character along with Mark Swift, founder of Oh, The Fool, through a tarot card reading that will determine their characters place in the world- perhaps occupation, weaknesses, strengths and goals. Players of Project: Fate will receive correspondence from their characters with updates on the world and their adventures within, players are then encouraged to respond to their characters with advice on how the characters should proceed. Will you be an evil mastermind, an incorruptible force for good, or perhaps a wandering adventurer who stumbles upon a grave secret? Find out in Project: Fate. 

Canterbury Festival: Are you a writer, actor, or storyteller of some kind? Have you ever wanted to get your story in front of an audience but didn't know where to start? That's where the Canterbury Festival comes into play. In a celebration of stories of all sizes and shapes, the Canterbury Festival hopes to be an annual production where story-tellers can have their work meet an audience in person. This project is in its early conception stage, but hopes to have its first meeting in 2018.

Seance Fiction: Taking the same form as it's predecessor, Seance Fiction is a choose your own adventure  radio play wherein listeners will take the part of an ancient demon who is summoned to the mortal plane by several unknowing high-schoolers. The choices you make will send the rag-tag group through the adventure of a lifetime, or perhaps- several lifetimes.

Get In Contact!

If you have any questions at all, please feel free to email us at TheAbsoluteFool@gmail.com, and give us a follow on twitter @TheAbsoluteFool.

At the Final tier you get both! Ten Card Tarot Reading: One of the two rewards exclusive to the final tier is the ten card reading. This reading is more heavily involved then the previous two and will be done via a live video chat so you can enjoy a more personalized experience. On The HorizonWhile "Life in Sonderville" is Oh, The Fool's primary project, we realize that backers want to feel like their donation is an investment. We at Oh, The Fool have grand ambitions beyond "Life in Sonderville;" please take a look below.Project: Fate: This incredibly ambitious project is one that takes personalized storytelling to the next level. Taking inspiration from Dungeons and Dragons, Tarot, and H.P. Lovecraft's Cthulhu mythos, Project: Fate will have subscribers (and top tier donors) create a character along with Mark Swift, founder of Oh, The Fool, through a tarot card reading that will determine their characters place in the world- perhaps occupation, weaknesses, strengths and goals. Players of Project: Fate will receive correspondence from their characters with updates on the world and their adventures within, players are then encouraged to respond to their characters with advice on how the characters should proceed. Will you be an evil mastermind, an incorruptible force for good, or perhaps a wandering adventurer who stumbles upon a grave secret? Find out in Project: Fate. Canterbury Festival: Are you a writer, actor, or storyteller of some kind? Have you ever wanted to get your story in front of an audience but didn't know where to start? That's where the Canterbury Festival comes into play. In a celebration of stories of all sizes and shapes, the Canterbury Festival hopes to be an annual production where story-tellers can have their work meet an audience in person. This project is in its early conception stage, but hopes to have its first meeting in 2018.Seance Fiction: Taking the same form as it's predecessor, Seance Fiction is a choose your own adventure  radio play wherein listeners will take the part of an ancient demon who is summoned to the mortal plane by several unknowing high-schoolers. The choices you make will send the rag-tag group through the adventure of a lifetime, or perhaps- several lifetimes.Get In Contact!If you have any questions at all, please feel free to email us at TheAbsoluteFool@gmail.com, and give us a follow on twitter @TheAbsoluteFool.

story:
A Little About Me

My name is Earl Hazel Jr. I am a 27 year old Freelance Videographer born and raised in the British Virgin Islands.  I have always had a passion for the arts, and a deep love for cinematography. I am also a history geek and a sucker for a good story. Growing up in my closely knit community, I have been entertained by, eavesdropped on and even experienced for myself the history, culture and wonders of my island home. I want to share these stories with the world.

“Being VI” Docu-Vlog

"Being VI" is a documentary-styled vlog consisting of 10-15 minute episodes released weekly on YouTube. Viewers can follow me as I seek to discover and share the experience, memories, tales and adventures of the locals and visitors of the Virgin Islands. The aim is to expose those aspects of life in my country that aren't talked about often, or that are at risk of being forgotten. Initially, “Being VI” was a 50 minute documentary I’ve been planning since 2015. I decided to switch to the vlog format because:

  • I didn’t want to rush into a big project. This vlog will basically be weekly 10-minute long documentaries, giving me the opportunity to refine my craft through practice.
  • Producing a feature-length documentary is expensive. Producing a vlog is a lot cheaper.
  • I can expound on stories of interest and focus on current events if “Being VI” was episodic (as opposed to being a 50 minute film).
  • I refuse to let another year end without it becoming reality. Adapt and conquer!

 

My Fundraising Goal

The goal of this campaign is to raise US $3500 to assist with obtaining equipment needed for the production of the docu-vlog. I have several goal tiers:

Q: What happens if I don’t raise all of the funds?

A: This Campaign has a Flexible Goal, meaning that I get to keep the money raised even if it doesn’t reach it’s goal. The cost associated with fulfilling all claimed perks will be settled before any money is spent otherwise. After that is settled, this is how I’ll be spending the money:

  • Campaign raises over US $1500 (Minus perks and fees) - I will purchase the camera and lens, and use the remaining funds to offset the cost of the drone.
  • Campaign raises under US $1500 (Minus perks and fees) - I will use the funds to offset the cost of the camera and lens.

Q: What happens if I surpass my goal?

A: Well first off, I’d break into my happy dance, your combined generosity would be too much. Any surplus will go towards upgrading my  current equipment (sound gear, computer storage/speed, storage for equipment, etc.), travelling fees, permits and other expences related to the production of "Being VI".
 

My Reason for Doing This…

The driving force behind this venture is three fold:

It’s Personal - For as long as I can remember, I have been an artist. From painting to songwriting to cinematography, the ability to express myself, portray an idea or emotion, or to tell a story through a medium has been a big part of my everyday life. This vlog is my way of continuing my passion. 

The Ripple Effect - The cinematography community in the BVI is very small. There are not many opportunities for young people interested in this field to garner experience and create meaningful content. My motto is “If you can’t find it, start it”. I would love to see public awareness of the craft grow, but for that to happen a few of us have to take that first step and show what we are capable of.

The Future - Documentaries and vlogs provide a window into the times and experiences they record. This vlog is me preserving a small part of Virgin Islands history, and is my gift to the next generation of Virgin Islanders and adventurers worldwide.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge I am facing is time. I work full-time as a computer technician (techie's gotta tech) and I am aware that the planning, editing, liaising with interviewees, getting permits, ect, required for such a project can be borderline excruciating.

That's why for the past year, I have been organizing a schedule (made for the documentary, re-done for an episodic series ) that will aid in managing the time I have so the vlog is produced and released consistently and on time. I am no stranger to sacrifice, and my art is my life. I am committed to making the best possible content, and making the vlog a success.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help, but are unable to make a monitory donation, it’s ok! A HUGE part of making “Being VI” a success is getting the word out! Below are some other ways you can contribute:

  • You can share this campaign with people you know on Indiegogo, at work, the gym, or wherever you know people! 
  • Feel free to send in your suggestion on how I could make the campaign better, other perks you might like yourself, or what you would like to see in the vlog!
  • You can leave a supportive comment on the campaign page!
  • Don’t forget to make use of the Indiegogo share tools!

As we say here, "Leh we do dis ting!" Help me share "Natures Little Secret" with the world!

story:
It's Time

For too long, we have hopped from subreddit to subreddit avoiding ban with little success. It is time that we built our own home, free from censorship, where we might rekindle the communities that we lost in previous ban waves.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We do not need much money, as I will be fronting many of the costs myself. My hope is to raise enough to pay for the initial month or two of server hosting, just long enough to make the transition from reddit to our new home.

A big reason behind this campaign is getting you invested in this site prior to its launch. This site will only work if it has a community behind it, and while some of you have been crying out for a site like this for some time, others may need more of a reason to be invested in it enough to make the change.

By crowdfunding, I hope to get more members of the incel community invested in the new site, so that, when the time comes (and it will be coming soon) the exodus will be awe inspiring in its magnitude.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute financially, you still have an important role to play in the success of our new home. Spreading the word to fellow incels, both on reddit, and elsewhere, to ensure that the name incel.win is in the minds of all our brothers is paramount.

story:
Getting Us Together 

 

The world is shifting incredibly fast. Decisions are being made, money is being exchanged, and power is being used in a way that often neglects the voices of the people who have been historically disenfranchised. Despite this, the global Black community, especially those living in the United States, is ready for a change in its how money, time, and influence is used and understood. However, there is a lot of misdirection about how to how forward. 

 

We offer The Our Come Up Podcast is an answer . We present well researched insight into topics in economics in an easy-to-understand way. Our highly curated, narrative journalism style episodes cover topics that are unique to Black communities. We want to unify information by busting myths, giving practical advice, and fostering conversation on crucial topics. Its founder, Jacob Dennis, is a young black aspiring economist who finished his undergraduate degree in economics at the University of Maryland Baltimore County and is passionate about making the collective move forward more well informed.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $4,000 dollars to cover our equipment costs and part of our production costs for the first 10 episodes. Microphones, broadcast recorders, studio time, travel for interviews… all of these are upfront costs that add up quickly. None of the money raised will go towards labor; we want to ensure that the basics of production are covered first.

In return for your support, we want to show our appreciation with content! We want to offer premium content, merchandise, and more. 

If we do not reach our goal, all funds raised will go towards gathering the equipment we need to create high quality episodes first. From there, we will continue our private funding efforts and will produce content as best we can.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge is traction. There is a budding interest in economics issues among the younger college educated demographic, however it is unclear if this interest would translate to consistent listenership. The second biggest challenge is the proliferation of the podcast. We are confident that with all the news circulating about economic empowerment in the community, that people are searching for reliable and digestible information to use. However, podcasting is still a relatively young form of media consumption, particularly among people of color. We will have to grind hard to ensure that the people know about our content.

We plan to address the first issue by testing different versions of episode formats to see what listeners connect with the best. In doing so we will maximize the chance of listeners returning for future episodes. With respect to the second, we plan to do a mix of aggressive social media campaigns as well as live events in Prince George’s County, Maryland to help give the podcast regional momentum.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are currently looking to put a team together! We are looking for journalists, audio editors, and folks to work in our business division. For any further inquiries, email Jacob Dennis directly at jwd286@stern.nyu.edu

story:
Lets make it right!

Fans of the Bloodybits Horror Show know I take my horror movies seriously. That is why I am often brought on as a guest expert on the Grindbin podcast when they are covering a film in this genre. I did so for the cult classic Slumber Party Massacre 1. The resulting podcast has gone down in the annals of history as the definitive commentary on the subject. Transcending the source material for which it was based upon.

 

Then the bait and switch.

“Everyone makes mistakes, but only a person with integrity owns up to them.”  

Nicole Guillaume

When I was asked back on to cover the sequel, it made perfect sense. Why mess with a winning recipe? Just come back in, and do it again. In a very real sense, we were creating a sequel. I thought it couldn't go wrong. I was going to live forever.......  I was wrong.

The "movie" I was presented, Slumber Party Massacre 2 (ugh, it hurt typing that) was a sequel in name only. Here is just a short list of my grievances.

  • The driller killer lacked the same charisma/charm
  • The Co-Hosts brought in on this episode hadn't even seen the first movie until after seeing the fake sequel, and worse they THOUGHT IT WAS BETTER THAN THE ORIGINAL.
  • I think at one point when we were recording, I got a beer, and we were out of lighter easy drinking beers, so I had to get an IPA. Though in hindsight that was more my own doing. 

A second chance.....?

“It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves.”
William Shakespeare - Julius Caesar

Well on 8/26/202 I was browsing Ebay, looking for inspiration to dig me out of my morally and creatively bankrupt hole I have been living in ever since, when something caught my eye. Cheerleader Massacre. Something was eerily familiar about the cover to this movie. I searched it up, and Lo and behold i'd stumbled upon the TRUE sequel to Slumber Party Massacre.  It even includes Brinke Stevens reprising her role as Linda Dawn Grant, and is produced by Roger Corman and lensed by Jim Wynorski. It was as if fate had taken my hand, and sought to correct a universal injustice.

The harsh reality

"The truth of the matter is that you always know the right thing to do. The hard part is doing it." Robert H. Schuller

Folks, I'm not going to lie to you. This journey won't be easy. I need to like, buy the dvd. And it's 24 bucks. Then hosting, streaming the live event blah blah blah. indigogo made me set it at 500, but it pays once it's over 100, so then I want to pay the guests so we can all get at least a half case of Coors Banquets, and whatever is left.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Spread the word, tell people to subscribe to the Grindbin Patreon. Currently they have 68 subscribers, and 69 is a much funnier number.
  • Wish on a star. That might of worked a time or two.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
We're trying to make a wrestling podcast that's different

We're trying to take wrestling seriously as something that's in the world, that can teach us about the world. We're trying to provide fresh takes that are based on research and ideas and reading and thinking. We're trying to dig deep down into our subjects so that we can really get to grips with their nuances and what it is that draws us to them

All of this takes hard work!

That's why we're reaching out to you to ask us to support our efforts. Did you enjoy our first episode, with its in-depth discussion of Idol culture, millenial mental health crises and the way that Maki Itoh brings all of these to the wrestling ring? There's plenty more where that came from. Please show your support and help us improve the lamentable state of pro wrestling criticism little by little!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

1212DIGITAL, Inc. is a New York-based company that provides digital media platforms for aspiring and upcoming artists and entertainers. We are looking to now provide a new platform, where these artists and entertainers will have direct access to getting additional airplay without having to jump through hoops or pay for any irrelevant "promotional packages" just to have their song played.

At our radio station, artists and entertainers will be able to develop their mic and interview skills from our weekly classes, fans will be able to discover new talent and content from our daily playlists and shows and we will get to do what we do best and provide entertainment.

Purpose

The purpose of this fundraiser is to ask for assistance in helping us raise the rest of the funds needed to make this happen, legally and licensed. We are not looking to be limited in any way, form or fashion. With your help, this will allow us to launch on schedule and bring value to the industry once again.

The Impact

There are over a million music artists in the United States alone going after a mere chance of being heard and or seen. Though we know it is unrealistic to say this will be home to all, but it can be to some. The level of confidence that comes to one from just hearing that first Yes can be the spark needed for the next Michael Jackson, Elvis Presley, Beatles, etc.

Risks & Challenges

This is just to help us launch. We are well aware that marketing and promotion is going to take a lot more than what we are asking for and we are more than ready to put in the work. It has to start somewhere though and that's all we are asking for.  

The biggest factors to help separate our station from anyone else's will be the overall mission and the classes. If it was just to play music, we can do that on several platforms, but for a brand new artist to have a place to not only test his/her content but be able to hone and mold it is something no other station is providing right now which is where the true value of radio comes in at.

Other Ways You Can Help

We have additional ways you can assist us as well besides monetarily.

- You can share this with your music friends and entertainers on social media and local press. Let them see what is coming for them.

- We never pretend to know it all so if you have any advice, guidance and or skills that you would like to share, feel free to contact us.

story:
Я - создатель цикла аудиокниг ТЕМНАЯ БАШНЯ

6 аудиокниг уже создано - за 10 лет. Осталась последняя.

Сумма - символическая. Сколько соберем - столько и соберем.

Ваши несколько сотен рублей - это ваш вклад в работу над книгой!

Вы получите книгу в любом случае - на моем канале.

Я буду выкладывать всю рабоут по частям. 

Никаких рисков.

Работа над книгой уже началась.

Следите за озвучкой здесь.

https://vk.com/vargtroms

story:
Short Summary

Our goal is to host the long-awaited debate between Steven Crowder and Sam Seder that nearly occurred on June 21st, 2021 by raising the necessary funds for Steven Crowder's honorarium:

 

We have already reached out to Steven Crowder's agent online. 

IF THIS DEBATE DOES NOT HAPPEN FOR ANY REASON, EVERYONE GETS 100% OF THEIR CONTRIBUTION BACK. ZERO RISK.

We've successfully hit our goal for all of our past crowdfunds (one here on IGG and one on Kickstarter) for debates. I (James) have set up and hosted/moderated over 600 debates, mostly online, though several were in person (a handful in Texas, one in Los Angeles, one in Wisconsin).

We started Modern-Day Debate 2.5 years ago because we wanted to ensure that people from all walks of life had a fully-neutral and fair platform they could make their case on, or hear other people make their case on!

We host debates on science, religion, and politics, because we believe debate has the potential to change cultures for the better by getting people with different perspectives to communicate, and to show that people can disagree and still be friends.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are fundraising to cover Steven Crowder's necessary honorarium and the remaining funds ($14,300) beyond that amount are to cover the taxes I (James) would have to pay on the total. We plan on launching a stretch goal for Sam Seder's honorarium as well. I (James) will not be taking any cut of the funds.
  • Perks are being decided (open to suggestions, but we prefer to not add monetary perks [e.g., merchandise] so that we can keep the total crowdfund goal as low as possible.
  • IF THIS DEBATE DOES NOT HAPPEN FOR ANY REASON, EVERYONE GETS 100% OF THEIR CONTRIBUTION BACK. ZERO RISK.

The Impact

  • We want to provide a neutral platform for each side to make their case on a level playing field. 
  • We have successfully hit our goal on both of our past crowdfund goals for other debates (one here on IGG and one on KickStarter).
  • We plan on hosting the event in-person in Los Angeles.

Risks & Challenges

  • IF THIS DEBATE DOES NOT HAPPEN FOR ANY REASON, EVERYONE GETS 100% OF THEIR CONTRIBUTION BACK. ZERO RISK.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give, please retweet, as many hands make light work. EXAMPLE: If 2,572 people gave $25, which is the average crowdfund donation, we will hit our goal.

story: A few of you have been asking for a lollujo FC replica shirt. There isn't a way that I can find to do them print on demand, so we're going to have to put through a bulk order. If we can get at least 20 people who all want one, then we can put the order through. Don't panic, you won't be charged until we have 20 people, so you'll only pay when your shirt is actually ordered. You can personalise with your own name and number.

Don't panic, you won't be charged until we have 20 people, so you'll only pay when your shirt is actually ordered. You can personalise with your own name and number.

story:
Hello, everyone.

bathrobeDFS here.

My life has had its share of turbulence, but one thing has always remained constant: my love of consuming in-depth research, interpreting its meaning, and sharing it with others in a way that’s easy to understand.  

This appetite for taking something complicated and simplifying it is what led me to become a two-time national debate champion. It’s what attracted me to studying journalism at an Ivy League university. And it’s ultimately why I created Bathrobe Sports, a digital hub for those who love daily fantasy sports but may not have the time to do all the tedious work of interpreting advanced statistics.

You see, to me, the numbers behind a game are where you see the true beauty in sports. To gain an understanding of what’s happening on and off the field, all you have to do is take a look at the right stats. Over the years, this notion of analyzing statistics to accurately predict the outcomes of games – or even whole seasons – has gained traction, particularly in the world of baseball, so much so that it was even given its name: saber-metrics.  

Saber-metrics – made popular by Moneyball – allows both fans and management to gain a previously unavailable depth of team-specific understanding that has been revolutionary for the sports industry. When I discovered sabermetrics, I was elated.

Not only did it deepen my love for baseball, but my love for all sports. The visibility it allows into the industry opened a new world of data analysis that I could not consume fast enough. I was instantly hooked.

And as it turns out, I wasn’t the only one.

Today, the use of stat analysis to inform decision-making in daily fantasy sports is commonplace. What’s different about the service I provide is not only the access to stats and analysis but the context around what it all means in the larger picture of the industry.

For a year and a half, I have been on Reddit creating a DFS community where data and insights lead to conversation, camaraderie, and connection.

Now it’s time to take things to the next level.

The Next Step

When I started, my goal was to create a hub for DFS strategies, advice, and conversation. Even if those things happened on linked, third-party sites, the important thing was creating a community for fans because, let’s face it, having other people to talk to, brag to, or complain to, makes DFS more fun.

However, the limitations of this platform have made me realize that this great community - and all DFS players who will join our tribe moving forward - deserves a single, centralized location where it can access everything (and I mean everything) it needs to with ease and precision.

So, bathrobe, what are you getting at?

While the pandemic has put sports (and life) on pause, at roto.life we have used this downtime to work hard at developing solutions to these problems ー a new platform that meets all of our DFS needs.

I know this is a big vision. That’s why, for more than two months, we have been working tirelessly to figure out how to make it a reality. We could have taken the easy way out and sold ads on our site, but that’s not us, so we continued to explore alternatives.

As luck would have it, we were approached by a national tech incubator that believes in our vision, loves our product, and most importantly, understands DFS.

This investment in the future of roto.life is very exciting and, to be honest, very expensive.

We’ll be creating an entirely new platform from scratch while working with some of the best developers in the business to create what I know will be the most reliable DFS site, fueled by the best community, anywhere. Best of all - our goal is still to provide as much free content as possible while charging significantly less than other providers for any paid content. And giving some of that money back to you and other worthwhile causes.

While I have always appreciated and accepted donations, I have never asked for money before. It always felt inappropriate for me to even bring it up. But the work I am doing now is to take this community to another level so I’m going to put myself out there and ask you, the r/DFSports community that’s been so amazing to me for so long, help us build the platform you deserve.

Whatever you can donate, we would greatly appreciate it. As always, thank you for your continued support, friendship, and for being a shining light in the DFS community.

ー bathrobeDFS

story:
Who We Are

The Geekiary is a By Fans, For Fans geek news website founded in 2013.  We started as a simple Wordpress blog with just 3 authors and then moved over to our domain and hosting later that year.  Since then we've grown to well over a dozen consistent contributors, over 40 guest contributors, two podcasts, two webcasts, a book, and so much more on the way.  We've focused on lifting up under represented groups in the geek community as well as reporting on things from a fan perspective outside the traditional media. 

Our Tech Issues

Over the past few weeks we've begun to notice that certain plugins were giving us issues and we'd get error messages about our current server being out of date.  Then our database backups started to fail.  On Saturday we called tech support and were advised that we'd need to switch to a new server to ensure our plug ins would continue to work.  They weren't sure why our database backups weren't working, but they opened a ticket.  We were told our website would go down for up to two days during this process and that they'd reach back out to us about the database issue accordingly.

Yesterday (Tuesday January 29th) we were advised that the database back up issue was due to us exceeding our file usage limit and that our website would not come back online until we either deleted older content or upgraded to a business plan.  In order to bring things back online quickly, we opted to go with the business plan.

Our Financials

The Geekiary makes money off our ads and Patreon.  This goes directly back into the website.  Here's our financial outline.

UPDATE: Thanks to our fundraiser, we've found a more affordable hosting plan.  We will be saving $308 over the course of two years.  We unfortunately can't change our stated goal.  We no longer need $700.  More like $400.  We are just unable to update that part of the campaign once it goes live.

2018 EARNINGS

Adsense Earnings 2018: $345.07
Patreon Earning 2018: $306.46

TOTAL EARNINGS: $651.53

2019 EXPENSES

SSL Renewal: $156.73 (non refundable)
NEW Non GoDaddy Host: $720
Non Refundable GoDaddy Cost: $83.7

TOTAL EXPENSES: $960.43

TOTAL DEFICIT: $308.90

PREVIOUS GO DADDY INFO:

REFUNDED: Database Backups: $74.99
PARTIALLY REFUNDED ($445.87): Business Account: $529.57
Hosting Renewal (New Server): $506​

 

Our Request

The last time we asked for funding was nearly two years ago.  We promised it would take us through to 2019 without having to ask for money again.  We're glad that we generally kept that promise and have sustained ourselves with Patreon and Adsense for two years.  Unfortunately we've grown too large for those two things to take our website to the next level and we are asking you to assist.

story:
Short Summary


My Life has been a rollacoster! Being unable to complete my Degre in Information and Technology at Northrise University, has changed my perspective on problems and how to solve them.

My name is Lubosi jr Maboshe.I was born in Kitwe,Zambia.The town is known as a business district in one of the smallest provinces, in Zambia,called Copperbelt.I am currently living in Luanshya district.A very remote town within the same province.

This campaign  will raise money for me to impact my community through technology.Currently the local clinic in my community has no presence on the internet.This is something we can achieve with funds.The government run community services lack technology and still rely on the old colonial system to manage some of the community clinics,schools,libraries and town council. 

What We Need & What You Get

​With these funds.A website for 'the youth friendly corner' will be launched for a period of one year.This group represents the youth who volunteer to work with the local clinic at newtown, to spread knowledge on health services offered by the clinic,HIV/AIDS,Alcohol abuse,Child abuse,and other health issues that are affecting our youth in our community.

Part of the funds will be invested in an online financial course that will empower the youth to learn how to raise money through e-commerce to surpport the government to help the local clinic in Newtown.


The Impact


This project will enable the youth of my community access health information

Other Ways To Help

Please dont get discouraged if you luck funds.We can share this campaign using indiegogo's sharing tools to spread the word.Your voluntary sharing help will still be of value.

story:
Rock Star Dreams

Patrick is a smart, creative 8 year-old boy. He loves building things, telling jokes, and turning the family dining room into a formal restaurant. 

Inspired by YouTube channels like "The Axel Show", Patrick started his own channel - "The Patrick Show". With 7 videos and counting, Patrick now wants to take his show into the great outdoors - forests, beaches and parks across California.

Today Patrick announced to the family he is creating an Indiegogo campaign to purchase a GoPro rugged outdoor camera. Which means Dad is writing this text. And Dad's mobile phone will be relatively safe.

 

Next-Level Storytelling

Help Patrick create "exciting adventure" videos, complete with props and action stories (but "still not too dramatic"). Your donation pays for new gear:

  • Outdoor GoPro camera
  • Camera memory card, additional battery
  • Safety harness
  • Handheld camera mount

 

What You Get

If funding goals are reached, you'll see his smiling face exploring nature in "The Patrick Show". Patrick is grateful for your support - these are the perks he requested. 

  • A thank you shout-out in the first GoPro-based video
  • Your name in the credits 
  • Your very own "The Patrick Show" t-shirt

 

Other Ways To Help

Every bit of support helps Patrick at this point, and is much appreciated. 

  • Subscribe now to Patrick's YouTube channel 
  • Share your favorite video with friends

 

Thanks!

story:
Objectif c'est d'avoir une collection presque complete de FF15 

Je suis un grand fan de FF et surtout FF15

L'achat de different livre et produits dérivé et les présenter.

What We Need & What You Get

On a besoin d'une somme d’argent qui nous permet d’achetés ces produits.

Ou bien de donateur qui nous offerts ou nous achetés ces produits et nous envoies.

The Impact

Rassemblé une bibliothèque de rue pour des fans de cette univers et partager l'objective avec nos amies et les personnes qui partages cette amour.

Risks & Challenges

Ne pas réussir a voir des produits rare ou édition limité

Ne pas trouver des produits qui représenter les différents personnage.

Je suis un grand fan de FF et surtout FF15
L'achat de different livre et produits dérivé et les présenter.
What We Need & What You Get

Ou bien de donateur qui nous offerts ou nous achetés ces produits et nous envoies.
The Impact
Rassemblé une bibliothèque de rue pour des fans de cette univers et partager l'objective avec nos amies et les personnes qui partages cette amour.

story:
Short Summary

We - Sharifa and David - love Tai chi. Sharifa is a experienced Tai chi coach, and she kept practicing Tai chi during pregnancy. Now we have a beautiful baby, it's wonderful!

We're hoping to create an serials video courses to share our experiences, so every expecting moms around the world could be benefit from the oriental martial art. We need some fund to hire script writer, professional editors to make all things done.

Your back is essential to make this happen!

What We Need & What You Get

We need to hire some script writer, professional editors to finish all the staffs. My wife Sharifa is an experienced Tai chi coach. But my background is in IT area. We need to hire some professional freelancer to help us to make all staff finished. 

The Impact

Sharifa is an experienced Tai chi coach. Mean while, she kept practicing Tai chi during pregnancy tills the day before the birthday of our baby. When we finished this video courses, the expecting moms need not go to Shenzhen to learn how to play Taichi during pregnancy. They can learn it in home and enjoy the miraculous effect of the "oriental moving mediation -- Tai chi".

Risks & Challenges

However, Sharifa is not the prefessional Video editor, neither I. And also, online video courses are totally different to face to face coaching. But we're eager to learn how to overcome our shortage. and we can hire professional freelancers to consult, to review and to do some special staffs for us. I know there are some professional guys and gals in Fivver.

Other Ways You Can Help

And if you're professional video editor, or you're experienced in creating online video courses, and would like to help us, feel free to let us know.

story:
Join hosts Eric, Keenan, and DJ Boogie as they give their Ignorant Philosophy on pop culture, relationships and social issues each week. As young African-Americans living and working in the Midwest, Ignorant Philosophy serves as weekly therapy for four friends just trying to figure out adulthood. From understanding the sentiments of their parents to breaking down proper f-buddy manners, Ignorant Philosophy provides much-needed light-hearted comedic commentary of a world that can sometimes take itself a bit too seriously.

Email us - IgnorantPhil@Gmail.Com

story:
As you know here at Makem Takem all we are trying to do is increase the amount and quality of coverage that basketball fans in the UK receive.

We run the site, podcast and everything we do on a voluntary basis with all our costs coming out of our own pockets. Hopefully as we grow we will bring on sponsors to cover our costs but until then we are drastically limited by our lack of finance.

We would love to bring you more coverage from the big UK basketball events but to do so we need to spend £730 on some new kit (which you can see in the picture above). This kit will enable us to broadcast live from the biggest basketball events in the UK.  No, we won't be bringing you the games themselves but we aim to bring you interviews with players, coaches, celebs anyone we can get hold of who we think you would like to hear from.

If you can help out with a small donation it will help us get this new kit and bring you more brilliant basketball coverage.

This is an example of the NBA using the tech to give you an example of what we can bring you, https://www.facebook.com/nba/videos/10155241094...

story:
Story

Ouroboros is a scripted narrative podcast that discusses the intersection of technology, mental health, and privacy. The story follows the relationship between Emma, a 26 year old burn out, and her Artificially Intelligent therapist, Gus. Emma encounters a not so distant future where her online data is used to customize her medical treatment. As we step into the 2020s, the data we create will mean everything in our hyper fragmented and highly customized market. This narrative allows us to peak into a future where a high value for commercial progress outranks the privacy and mental health of consumers.  

Budget

$700 festival entry fees

$700 festival travel accommodations

$300 VR hardware and software

Benefits 

Funding would help us get a lot of crazy cool things done. While most of the funding goes to festival submission and travel accommodations, part of our funding is for hardware that would allow us to bring this story into a new dimension. If funding allows, the Ouroboros team would be able to produce an interactive version of the in-story counseling program, Ananta. Using Muse Neurosensing technology and Oculos GO VR, audiences would be able to engage with an interactive guided meditation that reacts in real time to their brainwaves/mental states. If you help us meet our goal, you’ll be bringing this story to life.

Cast + Crew

Cast

Jessika Dahlheimer is a BFA acting graduate. She’s the voice actress for Emma, this project’s protagonist. She’s committed to telling this story in the interest of raising positive awareness for mental illness.

Hershel Rocket is a senior sociology major. He’s the voice actor for Gus, this project’s antagonist and is interested this project because it takes a deep look at an issue that has become increasingly important to the millennial generation.

Michael Kean is a freshman yet to declare a field of study. He’s the voice actor for Jordan, this project’s supporting character. He’s excited to work with a diverse cast, and tell an emotionally meaningful story.

Department Heads

Gina Becnel is a senior Electronic Arts major with an emphasis in Interactive New Media Studies. She’s the writer and director for this project. She says this story is important because it discusses universal and socially contentious themes through a personal narrative.

Kefer Ladish is a senior Electronic Arts major with an emphasis in Audio Studies. He’s an audio engineer and composer for this project. He's passionate about audio being the focal point of story telling, and believes it's the perfect tool to connect with audiences emotionally. 

Chris Eiberger is a senior Electronic Arts major with an emphasis in Audio Studies. He’s an audio engineer and dialogue editor for this project. He says the topic that drew him to this project was the artificial intelligence and is interested in Gus could grow and change as a character. 

Other Crew

Jess Christensen is a senior Design major. He’s the producer and art director for this project.I Jess strongly believes in promoting dialogue around the themes of Ouroboros. He says mental health and its interactions with technology as well technology's widening prevalence in our lives is something we need to be thinking about. It's ingrained into our culture in ways that aren't always clear for better or worse, and to step back and look at these interactions in the context of a narrative is something worth while. 

Quinn Wolf is a senior in mass media. She is an audio assistant for this project. Her favorite part of this project has been getting to know my fellow teammates, first through their individual contributions to the podcast, and then through hanging out with them herself.

Bailey Pyle is a senior marketing and sales management major. She is the project's head of marketing. Her favorite part of the project has been working collaboratively. She loves being able to help support creative minds and to help them share their ideas using calculated and strategic approaches. 

Amanda Shields is a digital film production major. She is the script supervisor for this project.

 

Alex Harris He is junior in graphic design He is a graphic designer for this project.

story:
Short Summary

Domino Theory: the theory that if one act or event is allowed to take place, a series of similar acts or events will follow.

Supers have lived alongside us for as long as anyone can remember, but they live behind masks. They live double lives. Their families wouldn't accept them and the public doesn't care about the person behind the mask. Until they begin to make their voices heard.

A cast of five LGBTQ+ individuals analyze what it means to come out of the closet, as a superhero.

Season One features an amazing cast including Joey/Gnome (Tales from the Five Nations, Rise of the Demigods, Little Busters), DC (Mutants in the Night, Twitch Streamer, FLARE), Kikka (Twitch Streamer, Transgender Narrative Consultant), Russ Wilde (Prism Pals), and Kyle Allen (Prism Pals, Vanguards of the Horizon).

Season One is scheduled to have approximately 20 core episodes. This does not include bonus content.

The show is scheduled to launch in early April.

What We Need & What You Get

The money raised by this campaign will go towards upgrading audio editing software, initial website and host fees, official character art, and official theme music.

If our goal is not met we will prioritize which of these expenses are essential to creating a quality show that we are proud of and that you will enjoy!

Perks for donating include your name on our website as a part of our donor list, access to our first time playing together, having an NPC named after you, and even gaining access to all of Season One bonus content!

The Impact

This cast was assembled because of their diverse experiences as queer individuals and the need to get more stories like theirs out into the world. We are all passionate role players and this project is an exciting way to introduce more stories like ours into the podcasting community.

Risks & Challenges

This show is unlike anything producers Kyle and Russ have worked on before, but they are passionate about storytelling and want to see more queer narratives represented. When we began this project we didn't yet fully understand how much work would be involved in getting it  on its feet and everyday it seems like more and more aspects of it need to be addressed but we are working hard to deliver on something that we are proud of.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Follow us on Twitter and help promote the show.
  • Subscribe and listen when we launch!

story:
I currently do not have a place to host my podcast. I cannot have live guests or avoid barking dogs. I share an make shift studio with my bedroom and honestly it is interfering with my household. I would like to convert an old shed on my property into a quality studio. It seems easy enough besides, it needs electric, climate control, a floor and a few other things to be done properly.

 

Crowd funding this project seemed like to most sensible idea. As my YouTube channel only generates about $100 a month.

 

I plan on doing all the work myself besides the electrical and data cabling. That needs professional hands.

 

This is an all or nothing campaign, if I don't meet the goal I will end the crowdfunding and issue a refund.

 

Please help me grow. Thank you.

B

brianrichmond2016@gmail.com

story:
Herkese Merhaba,

Türkiye’nin en büyük podcast ağı olma misyonu ile çıktığımız yolda yaklaşık sekiz ayı geride bıraktık. Yola çıkarken tek ve çok önemli bir amacımız vardı. O da program yapmak isteyen içerik sağlayıcılara geniş bir ifade özgürlüğü sunmak. Geride kalan dönemde 25 program ile 250 bölüm podcasti sizlerle buluşturmaya çalıştık. Sürekli genişleyen ağımız bu süreçte 40 bine yakın dinlenme ve 25 bin civarında indirilme sayısına erişti. İyi bir teknik altyapı sunmak adına her gün araştırmalar yaptığımız bu süreçte, Patreon’da sizlerin de katkısı ile sürekli sistemlerimizi geliştirmeye çalıştık ve size en iyiyi vermeye çalıştık. Kullanıcıların da sürece dahil olması ile birlikte bugüne kadar hedeflediklerimizi büyük oranda yerine getirebildik ve Medyapod’u ayakta tutmayı başardık.

Ancak artık daha fazlasını istiyor ve medyada alanın daraldığı, ana akımda artan tek sesliliğe karşı gerçeklere ve toplumun tüm kesimlerine renk verme misyonumuzu daha da güçlü sürdürmek istiyoruz. İfade özgürlüğünü daha geniş bir kitleye eriştirmeyi amaçlıyoruz. Sadece Türkiye’de değil, tüm dünyada dinlenebilir birçok dilde içerikler üretmeyi hedefliyoruz. Medyapod’u siyasetten spora, teknolojiden müziğe dolu dolu içeriklerle çok daha büyük bir podcast ağı yapmayı planlıyoruz.

İşte bu yüzden bugün size her zamankinden çok daha fazla ihtiyacımız var. Kampanyamıza sağlayacağınız tek seferlik destek ile, artan program sayımız sonucu bununla paralel olarak ağırlaşan iş yükümüzü azaltmak üzere, bir editörümüzü tam zamanlı istihdam etmemize katkı sunacaksınız. Sizin bağışınızla maaş alacak bu editör, programların sosyal medya ve tüm mecralarda paylaşımı, bu alanda hazırlanan görseller ve yoğun iş dinamiğinde büyümemize ve varlığımızı sürdürmemize büyük katkı sağlayacak. İşte bu yüzden bir editörü bir yıl boyunca istihdam edecek bir destek kampanyası başlatıyoruz. Bütün bu süreçte her zaman söz taahhüt ettiğimiz gibi, yine şeffaflık ve ifade özgürlüğünü daima ön planda tutacağız.

Medyapod için siz de katkı verin. Gelin, ifade özgürlüğünü, çok sesliliği, Türkiye’nin en büyük podcast ağında hep birlikte yaşatalım.

www.medyapod.com

https://www.spreaker.com/medyapod

story:
Jij support de meest ambitieuze jonge ondernemers in Nederland. Als je al naar THE UNSTOPPABLE PODCAST luistert weet je dat ik altijd waarde geef.

 

Dit is jouw kans om ons te zien LIVE op beeld met ongelooflijk scherpe kwaliteit. Dit gaat de zeker een van de meest beluisterde podcasts worden omdat we allemaal diepe gesprekken kunnen voeren met overload aan humor maar waar je ook nog met het gevoel weg gaat dat je veel nieuwe dingen hebt geleerd.

 

Zie het als een 2 uur lange chill sessie met allemaal jonge succesvolle ondernemers en hun visie.

story:
Como tudo começou? E o que pretendemos com esta campanha?

O All Things Apple começou em agosto de 2017 com a criação do perfil Instagram “Notícias Apple”. Tal como o nome indica, este era um perfil Instagram que fazia chegar aos utilizadores as últimas notícias Apple de forma rápida e apelativa aos seguidores. 

O Instagram não é uma plataforma fácil de gerir nem tão pouco de conseguir seguidores. Mas o All Things Apple conseguiu conquistar o público através do seu formato inovador! Uma imagem apelativa acompanhada de uma descrição concisa. Assim redefiníamos a forma de dar a notícia.

Com toda a força dos nossos seguidores, decidimos dar o salto para a criação de uma plataforma completa, composta por podcasts, YouTube, e website. Desde a criação da plataforma, o All Things Apple cresceu de uma forma inacreditável. Conseguiu não só tornar-se líder do mercado a nível nacional como tornar-se numa referência a nível internacional ao ser nomeado para os Apple Awards - um prémio internacional atribuído aos melhores produtos Apple do ano bem como os melhores projetos (blogs, instagrammers e youtubers).

1 ano e 3 meses depois da sua fundação, o All Things Apple conta com cerca de 20 colaboradores, distribuídos por Portugal e Brasil. Um projeto liderado por jovens, com muita garra e vontade de fazer cada vez mais e melhor para a comunidade Apple de ambos os países.

E é por isso que surge a ideia deste crowdfunding. Precisamos do vosso apoio como há um ano atrás para criar todo este “império”! Queremos fazer-vos chegar mais e melhor conteúdo! Queremos soltar as amarras e voar bem alto!

Faz a tua contribuição no All Things Apple! Ajuda-nos a investir no YouTube, nos Podcasts, no desenvolvimento do site e de uma nova app! E isto é apenas uma pequena lista do pretendemos fazer... Ajuda-nos a crescer e não te vais desiludir!

Obrigado!

#WeAreAllThingsApple
story_txt:
Como tudo começou? E o que pretendemos com esta campanha?
O All Things Apple começou em agosto de 2017 com a criação do perfil Instagram “Notícias Apple”. Tal como o nome indica, este era um perfil Instagram que fazia chegar aos utilizadores as últimas notícias Apple de forma rápida e apelativa aos seguidores. 
O Instagram não é uma plataforma fácil de gerir nem tão pouco de conseguir seguidores. Mas o All Things Apple conseguiu conquistar o público através do seu formato inovador! Uma imagem apelativa acompanhada de uma descrição concisa. Assim redefiníamos a forma de dar a notícia.
Com toda a força dos nossos seguidores, decidimos dar o salto para a criação de uma plataforma completa, composta por podcasts, YouTube, e website. Desde a criação da plataforma, o All Things Apple cresceu de uma forma inacreditável. Conseguiu não só tornar-se líder do mercado a nível nacional como tornar-se numa referência a nível internacional ao ser nomeado para os Apple Awards - um prémio internacional atribuído aos melhores produtos Apple do ano bem como os melhores projetos (blogs, instagrammers e youtubers).
1 ano e 3 meses depois da sua fundação, o All Things Apple conta com cerca de 20 colaboradores, distribuídos por Portugal e Brasil. Um projeto liderado por jovens, com muita garra e vontade de fazer cada vez mais e melhor para a comunidade Apple de ambos os países.
E é por isso que surge a ideia deste crowdfunding. Precisamos do vosso apoio como há um ano atrás para criar todo este “império”! Queremos fazer-vos chegar mais e melhor conteúdo! Queremos soltar as amarras e voar bem alto!
Faz a tua contribuição no All Things Apple! Ajuda-nos a investir no YouTube, nos Podcasts, no desenvolvimento do site e de uma nova app! E isto é apenas uma pequena lista do pretendemos fazer... Ajuda-nos a crescer e não te vais desiludir!
Obrigado!
#WeAreAllThingsApple

story:
Short Summary

Creep is a brand new podcast, from writer Mel Hartman, who was also the writer of the 'Definitely Not Haunted' podcast, Disenchanted. This time around, instead of voicing the main character, they're looking to work behind the scenes and hand the voice work over to the awesomely talented voice actors out there, and good lord are there a lot of you!

Creep is about a detective that gets a case from an unlikely source, a case concerning a heist of a famous painting. Denver and Miami, former partners and still friends, team up with the help of the client, Sasha, to make sure nothing happens to the painting. However, Miami gets a bit more than he bargained for with a heist of a different kind. Can Denver save the day? You'll have to tune in to find out!

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Actors: Combined for both seasons, the actors will be paid $10 per episode, and with 3 main actors and a few smaller cameos for each season, we're looking at almost exactly $600.
  • Sound Design: While Mel is looking to do most of the sound design themselves, they would also like to bring in a more seasoned person to give advice where and when needed. At about 10 minutes of audio per episode, we're looking to pay them $1 per minute, so roughly $10 per episode. With 6 episodes per season, that's $120. 
  • Art and Music: We're looking for most of our music on free-as-long-as-you-credit sources, or simple one time purchases for the license (such as Pond5) so we're not too worried about that, but we'd love to have enough money to commission and artist or 2, as well as the money to order the stickers we're going to have as rewards, so we're hoping for about $200 in the art department.

This all totals around $920, which doesn't include Mel paying themselves anything. If you'd like to see Mel being paid as well, at $10 an episode which is what they're paying everyone else, we're looking at $1040 (but that'll be a stretch goal.) 

We're placing our goal at $1000 to account for the fees and taxes that are taken out.

Risks & Challenges

We understand that Covid-19 is a thing right now, and it's affected many people's livelihoods and jobs. Because of that, we totally understand that donating may not be a thing you're able to do right now, and we completely understand.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Use twitter, facebook, etc, to get the word out about our campaign! Share it to all of your friends!
  • Follow us on twitter at @CreepPodcast and don't forget to yell about how much you love the show to us once it's out! And you're more than welcome to review us on Podchaser and other podcast platforms as well when the time comes.

story:
【Your partner in the event of a power outage】
Let's face it. Everyone will experience a power outage and it's a terrible inconvenience. You can't cook, charge your phones, tablets, and computers. Or even worse, your family's lives could be at risk when you're unable to power critical medical devices.
You can't predict the unpredictable, but you can prepare for it. It's time to take charge and make a change. That is why Bluetti is here. Introducing the EP500 Series Power Station.


【It can save you money and protect the environment】
Can it only be used during power outages? Of course not!
By adding roof solar panels or portable solar panels, you can help offset part of your home's power usage. Not only can you save your electricity bills, but you can feel great about making a contribution to the environment by harnessing clean and free solar energy.

The BLUETTI EP500/Pro features 5,100Wh of LiFePO4 battery storage, 2,000W (or 3,000W) pure sine wave inverter, capable of providing all the power you need to keep your most essential and critical electronics running. Furthermore, it features Split Phase Bonding, seamless 24/7 UPS backup protection from power outages, plug-and-play usability, App remote control and a 6,000+ charge cycle. Offering you peace of mind and control when your neighbors may find themselves panicking without food and power.

 

 

There are so many energy storage devices on the market, such as fuel generators, lead-acid battery generators, as well as lithium batteries. Why should you choose us? Scroll down and we'll explain why!

【Compared to Lead-acid Batteries】
We offer a wide range of lithium iron phosphate (LiFePO4) batteries, which are the safest lithium battery type currently available on the market. Each battery has been specifically engineered to deliver high life cycles and excellent performance over a wide operating environment and temperature.

【Compared to Fuel-Based Generators】
A smarter alternative to traditional generators, the EP500 is fume-free and quiet. With no harmful emissions, our battery-powered generators reduce your carbon footprint and enable flexible indoor/outdoor operations.

【Compared to Power Stations】
Typical backup power stations currently on the market can only handle low-power equipment, have long recharge times, and support very few functions.

Regarding the safety, function, and price that customers care about most, it’s not hard to see the benefits. EP500 Pro Series will be your trusted life companion.

 

 

 

 

Designed as a flexible power station to meet various scenarios, the EP500 Series has different usages.

【Movable Power Station】
Because it’s meant to be portable and mobile, not something stuck to your wall or garage. The EP500 Series is a "no Installation needed" plug-and-play product that can easily be moved to the desired location when needed.

【In-grid UPS Mode】
Installing the BLUETTI UPS Box (Sub Panel) by a qualified licensed electrician will be able to wire in a dedicated circuit to connect your EP500 or EP500 Pro to the building’s main switchboard. Power everything from lights in high-use rooms and fridges to medical devices, internet modems, and more.

 

【Flexible UPS Mode】
In case of an outage, the UPS feature comes in handy. When EP500 Series detects a power failure, it automatically kicks into gear, which allows a computer or any of the most sensitive utilities that you can't afford to lose to keep running.

【Off-grid Energy Storage】
Take your BLUETTI EP500 Series completely off-grid by pairing it with your roof solar panels.

 

 

  • Multiple Devices Can Be Loaded Simultaneously

Traditional lithium batteries can only carry very few devices. Your BLUETTI EP500 Series are completely different. With 2000 (or 3000W) output, the EP500 Series can load devices simultaneously. Isn’t it spectacular!

Power outages can happen to anyone, anytime, and they can last days. Small portable batteries are mostly pointless during such times, as they don’t support high-powered appliances, nor will they last very long. To ensure you have power for days, you must have a large capacity battery, such as EP500 Series which is engineered with a 5100Wh large battery capacity.

 

  • Flexible Recharging Way To Keep Your EP500 Always On

EP500 Series can be powered by a variety of power sources, including AC charging, solar panels, and so on. This way, you can access the most convenient power sources when you need.

【From The Wall】
Throw away the big bricks, just using the included AC charging cable to recharge this battery pack through the AC input port. For EP500Pro, the charging speed depends on the ampere and voltage of the wall socket.

【From The Sun】
Use the earth’s best natural resource to top up! With a solar input and MPPT control up to 2400W (1200W for EP500), the EP500 Pro can be fully charged fast and safely in 2.6hrs and 4.75hrs for EP500.
MPPT stands for "Maximum Power Point Tracker," and a unit comes pre-installed on the EP500 Series. You'll get up to 40% faster charging than a standard charging port, and you'll see your most significant efficiency gains when solar charging.

【AC + Solar charging & Dual AC Charging】
Still want faster charging? No problem, we’ve got you covered. This class-leading unit can be recharged by using the AC + PV input port simultaneously.
- Recharge via solar and AC power simultaneously, you’ll get a maximum of 4000W input power.

- Recharge via dual AC power simultaneously (One AC charging cable and one BLUETTI T500 AC adapter).

 

  • Multiple Charging Outputs Provides More Options

​Single application energy storage systems, such as a Tesla Powerwall, are a thing of the past. The EP500 offers a wide range of powering options with seven versatile ports, including four industry-leading 2000W AC ports to run anything you could from a wall outlet. Power RV’s, trailers, off-grid events, worksites, essential circuits in your home, and more you might need to charge.

  • Split Phase Bonding Function

As an emergency energy storage power for the whole family, Bluetti has a pretty cool option to double the AC output and storage capacity. For higher power loads, Bluetti is releasing its own “BLEUTTI Split Phase Box.” Users can connect two EP500s in tandem to double the rated 4000-watt power output and double storage capacity with this accessory board. The Split Phase Box will also offer 220/240-volt output options to power 220-volt appliances. The high power output means you can now run your home air conditioner, clothes dryer, in-wall Electric Heater, Mining machine and other high power appliances with ease. No need to worry about power outages on hot summer nights or cold, bitter winters anymore.

Moreover, it can also be connected to the home grid in the Split Phase Bonding state.

 

  • Peak load Shifting

The EP500 Series can reduce your electricity bill by helping you manage your power efficiently. For example, you can charge the battery during off-peak hours, when electricity prices are lower. Then during peak hours, use the EP500 Series for your power needs. When connected to a private power station like a photovoltaic system, you can build a 24/7 operable private power network.

 

  • Control Power In The Palm Of Your Fingers

【App Control】
Monitor, control, and optimize your power usage from anywhere with the BLUETTI app, which offers remote control of power in/out, real-time power consumption notifications, and charging profiles to maximize your battery life. Moreover, you can enjoy the latest firmware update over Wi-Fi directly.

【Smart Touchscreen】
Most of the power stations didn't pay enough attention to the Human Machine Interface. EP500 Series comes with a smart touchscreen that simplifies the workflow of your daily projects, letting you manage the most-used tasks directly from the touchscreen.

 

 

In developing the EP500 Series, we prioritized product safety above all else, backed by multiple layers of protection. Regardless of circuit design, software programming, material selection, production process, testing and packaging, we have taken every precaution to ensure the product is safe under all conditions.

【Strict In Each Step】
We feel the most significant driver behind our continued growth is our focus on providing the highest quality products, coupled with the best service in our industry.
Our strict quality requirements mean that suppliers must meet numerous preconditions before cooperation. All our manufacturers undergo comprehensive auditing to determine whether they live up to our high standards and requirements.
Every BLUETTI product we built is a premium-quality product produced with the finest materials and to the highest standards. It’s a product you will be proud to own. Before shipping, all products undergo strict quality assurance tests with a focus on product construction and performance.

【 Remarkably Technology】
Modern times require modern technology. Thanks to the unique BLUETTI technology, the EP500 Series is far more powerful than you think.

 

 

With a high-efficiency monocrystalline solar cell, you will get greater power efficiency even though the panel is smaller than a traditional model. This model maximizes system output by reducing mismatch loss.
In addition, the solar panel folds up neatly into an easy-to-carry, 14.3-pound unit with a handle and a zippered pocket to hold cables. Around the back, you’ll find adjustable kickstands, which allow you to angle the panels towards the sun across a range of positions for maximum energy absorption.  

 

 

 
 
 
 

 

 

 

 

Hey Backers, BLUETTI is back! Thanks to your incredible support back in 2020, we were able to bring our first campaign into reality and made it the MOST funded project of an off-grid power station in crowdfunding history. Since our last successful crowdfunding project, we’ve fulfilled rewards and connected over 7,000 users worldwide.

Our first crowdfunding project was successfully fulfilled and here is the feedback: 

• Foundation & Our Mission
With ten years of industry experience, BLUETTI is committed to building premium portable power stations for explorers, naturalists, and off-grid living.
Before BLUETTI, we spent a decade heavily involved in the new energy industry. As such, we are the first manufacturer to launch portable energy storage solutions with rich industry experience and a strong R&D and production background.
We’re not only building a power station or a brand but rather seeding a community of encouragement while we grow our company along with our backers. We’re continually improving both the power station and our performances, listening to and seriously taking in feedback.

• Why Crowdfunding And Support Us Now
We only launch crowdfunding campaigns for cutting-edge products. Although we call it "crowdfunding," it's more like a pre-order and market validation phase. A product like EP500 requires a substantial investment in R&D and material reserve, and the most important thing is that we don't know how many customers would like to pay for the idea. With crowdfunding, we can understand customers' demands and improve the product during pre-production communication. It’s a collaborative process that is a win-win for both sides. If it's successfully funded, we can initiate mass production right away. Or, we can return all your money and call off the project.
Moreover, early backers can get a decent discount through this campaign by avoiding distribution and retail costs; it is available with a 30% discount on retail price. There will be no such favorable price in the future. Do not hesitate to grab yours today!
